0.title: What are the major announcements made for B'luru in state Budget 2022-23?
0.article_body: Presenting the 2022-23 state Budget, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai announced that ₹8,409 crore has been allocated for Bengaluru's development, including 1,000 crore for the Mekedatu project. He said that a skywalk will be constructed at Banashankari junction to connect the metro station with the bus stand. A mega jewellery park, 'Green Expo' and 'Namma Clinics' will be established in Bengaluru.

1.title: Will Smith, Michael B Jordan to star in and produce 'I Am Legend' sequel
1.article_body: Actors Will Smith and Michael B Jordan will star in and produce the sequel of 2007 film 'I Am Legend'. This will be the first time that the actors will work together. According to Deadline, Oscar-winning Akiva Goldsman, who adapted Richard Matheson's 1954 novel for the 2007 film, will return to pen and produce the sequel.

2.title: Over 7.8 lakh people have entered Poland from Ukraine since war began
2.article_body: More than 7,87,300 people have entered Poland from Ukraine since Russia invaded the country on February 24, Chancellery of the PM of Poland said. According to Polish Border Guards, a record 1,06,400 had entered the country from Ukraine on Friday alone. More than 12 lakh people have now fled Ukraine to escape war, the UN's International Organization for Migration said.

3.title: Warne will be remembered for what he did on, off the field: Labuschagne
3.article_body: Reacting to Australian spin legend Shane Warne's demise, Marnus Labuschagne tweeted Warne will be "forever remembered" for everything he did on and off the field. "Shocked and saddened at the news. Warne did so much for the game," added Labuschagne in his tweet. "The highlight of my...career was to keep wicket to Warne," read a tweet from Adam Gilchrist.

4.title: Aishwaryaa Rajinikanth wishes Dhanush's brother on b'day, calls him 'father figure'
4.article_body: Aishwaryaa Rajinikanth took to her Instagram Stories on Saturday to wish Dhanush's brother and director Selvaraghavan on his birthday. Sharing a picture of herself with Selvaraghavan, she wrote, "Happy birthday my guru, friend, father figure. And I can go on." Dhanush and Aishwaryaa announced their separation on January 17, after 18 years of marriage.

5.title: Warne will be missed, have fond memories of playing with him: Yuvraj
5.article_body: Mourning the demise of Shane Warne, Yuvraj Singh tweeted, "I have fond memories of playing with Warne. You will be missed. He was the king of spin and a legend of the game." "It is a sad day for world cricket," added Yuvraj in his tweet. "RIP legend," read a tweet from West Indies all-rounder Chris Gayle.

6.title: 3 women under trial for human trafficking attempt suicide in UP
6.article_body: Three women facing a human trafficking case allegedly attempted suicide outside a policeman's office in Uttar Pradesh's Shamli district on Friday. As per a note written by the women, they were facing social boycott and were shunned by their families after getting arrested in the case. They were rushed to a hospital and discharged later, police said.

7.title: Sushil Kumar to give wrestling, fitness coaching to fellow Tihar inmates
7.article_body: Wrestler Sushil Kumar, currently lodged in Tihar Jail in the Chhatrasal Stadium murder case, will soon be giving coaching classes on wrestling and physical fitness to his fellow inmates, prison authorities said. We have decided to restore the routine activities in prisons due to a decrease in COVID cases, an official said. Kumar was arrested on May 23 last year.

8.title: Completely crushed: Shibani Dandekar pens note after Shane Warne's demise
8.article_body: Former Indian Premier League host Shibani Dandekar took to her Instagram Stories to pen a note on former Australian cricketer Shane Warne following his demise. Sharing an old picture with Warne, Shibani wrote, "Completely crushed!" "Warney you were more than just a cricket legend! Your energy was infectious. Will always remember how warm, kind and crazy you were," she added.

9.title: Warne's display in 2005 Ashes made me want to be a cricketer: Root
9.article_body: Talking about Shane Warne who passed away aged 52, Joe Root said Warne's "phenomenal" performances in the 2005 Ashes in England made him want to become a cricketer, and play at the highest level. Warne was the top wicket-taker picking 40 wickets with two 10-wicket hauls and three five-wicket hauls. Andrew Flintoff was the second highest wicket-taker with 24 wickets.

10.title: Ukraine to join NATO cyber defence centre as 'contributing participant'
10.article_body: Ukraine will be joining the NATO Cooperative Cyber Defence Centre of Excellence (CCDCOE) as a "contributing participant". The CCDCOE said it would benefit from Ukraine's "valuable experience from previous cyberattacks". CCDCOE Director Colonel Jaak Tarien said Ukraine could bring "valuable first-hand knowledge of "several adversaries" within the cyber domain to be used for research and training.

11.title: Indian student's birthday celebrated at Romanian camp after escaping Ukraine
11.article_body: Indian student Kartik's birthday was celebrated at a camp on Romanian border on Friday. Kartik was among the Indian students and nationals who escaped Ukraine amid war with Russia. Indian government has been evacuating its citizens from the countries bordering Ukraine including Romania, Poland, Slovakia, and Hungary under Operation Ganga.

12.title: Feels good to work round the clock: Saiyami Kher on her busy schedule
12.article_body: Actress Saiyami Kher, known for films like 'Mirzya' and 'Choked', opened up about her busy schedule. "It feels good to be working around the clock," said Saiyami, who is currently shooting for 'Ghoomer' and 'Faadu'. "I know how tough the waiting game has been, so now when I have long hours of work, I'm...very grateful and very happy," she added.

13.title: Grubhub ends driverless robots delivery deal with Russia's Yandex
13.article_body: US delivery firm Grubhub has decided to end its partnership with Russian tech firm Yandex for driverless robots that deliver food to college students in the US. "We're working with our campus partners on alternate service options as we shift away from Yandex over time," Grubhub said. The two firms had agreed on a multi-year partnership in July.

14.title: Doing everything we can to evacuate foreign students from Sumy: Ukraine
14.article_body: Ukraine's Foreign Ministry said, "We're doing everything we can to evacuate hundreds of foreign students from the Sumy city." "Sumy is now on the verge of a humanitarian catastrophe due to indiscriminate Russian shelling. Ukraine is doing its best to save and secure people," it added. India has expressed "deep concern" over the security of its students stranded in Sumy.

15.title: UK opens 1st 'smart' prison with no window bars; inmates to be called 'residents'
15.article_body: The UK has opened the first "smart" prison designed with latest technology and with no bars on windows, to drive down crime and reduce reoffending. Her Majesty's Prison (HMP) Five Wells' cells will be called "rooms" and inmates "residents". The 1,700-capacity prison has been designed with education, training and jobs for prisoners on release as its main purposes, government said.

16.title: US Supreme Court reinstates Boston Marathon bomber's death sentence
16.article_body: The US Supreme Court on Friday reinstated the death sentence for Boston Marathon bomber Dzhokhar Tsarnaev for his role in the 2013 attack. In 2015, Tsarnaev was convicted of all 30 charges against him. Notably, Tsarnaev does not face imminent execution due to a moratorium imposed by President Joe Biden's administration on the death penalty in federal cases.

17.title: Putin's war has always been a war against his own people: Branson
17.article_body: Billionaire Richard Branson while expressing his thoughts on the Russian-Ukrainian war said Russian President Vladimir Putin's war has "always also been a war against his own people". He said Putin has created "a system of control, intimidation, oppression, and disinformation". He added Russians had their dignity "stripped away slowly but continuously" as Russia "slipped into totalitarianism".

18.title: Warne wasn't a big boozer; I sent him wine, 10 years later it's still there: Manager
18.article_body: Talking about late Australian leg-spinner Shane Warne, his manager James Erskine said, "Everyone thinks he was a big boozer but he wasn't a big boozer at all." Erskine added, "I sent him a crate of wine...10 years later it's still there. He doesn't drink...never took drugs. He hated drugs so nothing untoward." Warne passed away of a suspected heart attack.

19.title: Priorities fluctuated: Camila Cabello on break up with Shawn Mendes
19.article_body: Singer Camila Cabello, speaking about her break up with singer Shawn Mendes, said that her priorities have fluctuated and her focus has changed throughout her life. "We both started so young...We're...learning how to be healthy adults," she added. Camila further said that things change and take unexpected turns. They dated for two years before announcing their break up in November.

20.title: Indian chef wins ₹1 crore lottery in UAE, 24 years after first win
20.article_body: An Indian man working as a chef in UAE won a lottery of 500,000 Dirham (around ₹1 crore). Saidali Kannan won the Big Ticket draw for the second time, after winning a cash prize 24 years ago. "I've been sharing tickets almost every month with Saidali for the last 20 years. I believe he's very lucky," Kannan's friend said.

21.title: China announces $230 billion defence budget, 3 times that of India's
21.article_body: China has reserved $229.47 billion in the national budget this year to enhance military training and combat readiness for the People's Liberation Army. This is over three times that of India's ₹5.25 lakh crore ($70 billion) defence spending announced for 2022. China's defence budget has been increased by 7.1% as compared to last year.

22.title: Kapil Sharma in talks with 'Comedy Circus' producer for a film: Reports
22.article_body: Actor-comedian Kapil Sharma is in advanced talks with 'Comedy Circus Ke Ajoobe' producer Vipul D Shah for a comedy film, as per reports. Vipul is also co-producing Akshay Kumar, Pankaj Tripathi and Yami Gautam starrer 'OMG 2' with Ashwin Varde. Kapil will also be seen in Nandita Das' yet-untitled project, where he'll play the role of a food delivery rider.

23.title: Faridabad man held for plotting to shoot rival's family in court for revenge
23.article_body: Faridabad police arrested a man for allegedly plotting to shoot the family of an accused who had attacked his cousin in December 2021. The accused, identified as Aman, was arrested when he came to the district court to attack the family of Pradeep, who was one among the three accused who had attacked his cousin last year, the police said.

24.title: A magician on field: Preity Zinta mourns Shane Warne's demise
24.article_body: Actress Preity Zinta mourned the death of former Australian cricketer Shane Warne, who passed away on Friday at the age of 52. "So sad to hear that Shane Warne is no more. He was a magician on...field and such a charismatic and flamboyant personality off the field," Preity wrote on Instagram while sharing a picture with the late cricketer.

25.title: Russia, Belarus boxers barred from international boxing meets
25.article_body: In view of Russia's invasion of Ukraine, the International Boxing Association (IBA) has decided to bar Russian and Belarusian boxing contingents in international competitions. The decision has been taken on the lines of the International Olympic Committee (IOC) recommendations of cancelling sporting ties with them. The IBA also cancelled all upcoming boxing events scheduled in Russia and Belarus.

26.title: English county club Hampshire pay tribute to their former captain Shane Warne
26.article_body: Hampshire County Cricket Club paid tribute to their former captain Shane Warne, who passed away aged 52. The club chairman Rod Bransgrove called him "an inspirational leader and brilliant tactician". "Off the field, he was competitive, fun, naughty and lovable in equal measure," said Bransgrove. The English county club  tweeted an old photograph of Warne in Hampshire CCC colours.

27.title: IMD predicts strong winds in Delhi today
27.article_body: Delhi is likely to witness strong surface winds, up to 40 kmph, on Saturday, the Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) predicted. The department predicts the maximum temperature to be 26°C while the minimum temperature is likely to be 14°C. The minimum temperature over the next six days is set to be around 14°C and 16°C.

28.title: CBI lackadaisical, SEBI too kind: Court as it rejects Ramkrishna's pre-arrest bail
28.article_body: Rejecting ex-NSE chief Chitra Ramkrishna's anticipatory bail in the co-location case, a Delhi court called CBI's conduct "lackadaisical". It said, "The conduct of...CBI is most lackadaisical...no action seems to have been taken against the main beneficiaries of the...co-location scam...for almost four full years...Even SEBI, despite being the...markets watchdog, has been too kind and gentle."

29.title: Lyricist Vivek clarifies quitting 'Maaran' over creative differences
29.article_body: Ahead of the release of Dhanush-starrer 'Maaran', lyricist Vivek has clarified that he had walked out of the film. "Due to creative differences I chose to move out of Maaran as a dialogue and screenplay writer," Vivek wrote on Twitter after people praised him for the dialogues of the film. Directed by Karthick Naren, 'Maaran' also stars Malavika Mohanan.

30.title: Funded singles ourselves: Salim Merchant on filming music videos amid COVID-19
30.article_body: Singer-composer Salim Merchant opened up about filming music videos amidst the COVID-19 pandemic. "During the lockdown, we didn't know when we would perform next and where our revenue stream would come from," he said, adding, "Budget was a worry, as we funded the singles ourselves." Salim added the pandemic gave him time to complete the tracks that were lying unfinished.

31.title: Snapchat turns off public heatmap as safety precaution in Ukraine
31.article_body: Snapchat is temporarily turning off its 'heatmap' feature for Ukraine as a safety precaution amid the ongoing war between Ukraine and Russia. The app will no longer show how many Snaps are being taken in particular locations. "We will continue to offer curated Stories comprised of Snaps submitted in Ukraine," Snapchat said.

32.title: Want to contest 2024 Lok Sabha polls from Moradabad: Robert Vadra
32.article_body: Husband of Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi, Robert Vadra, said in an interview that he wants to contest the 2024 Lok Sabha election from his home town Moradabad. "As people have high hopes from me, I will see if I can participate in the 2024 general elections or not. Everyday I am in service of people," he added.

33.title: Ankit Gujjar used phones inside Tihar for money transfer requests: CBI
33.article_body: Gangster Ankit Gujjar, who was allegedly murdered inside Tihar Jail in August 2021, was unauthorisedly using a mobile number to make requests for money transfers, CBI said. He used to contact his family and friends to make requests for transfer of payments to various persons, including jail officials, CBI added. The number was used in 10 handsets, CBI stated.

34.title: Heavy snowfall in Uttarakhand's Chamoli disrupts movement
34.article_body: With heavy snowfall in the high altitude regions of Uttarakhand, the road connecting the Niti-Mana valleys in Chamoli largely remained blocked and caused problems for commuters on Saturday. The Border Roads Organisation (BRO) is clearing the path for the villagers and soldiers. "Due to changing weather trends, the BRO is caught in multiple clearance activities," said the BRO station commander.

35.title: Operation Ganga will be a failure if something happens to us: Students stuck in Ukraine
35.article_body: In a video, India students stuck in Ukraine said, "We are afraid, we have awaited a lot and we cannot wait anymore. We are risking our life. We are moving towards the border." "If anything happens to us...then Operation Ganga will be biggest failure," they added. "This is our last request and last video," they further said.

36.title: Not in race with everyone else: Anubhav Sinha on making OTT series
36.article_body: Director Anubhav Sinha opened up on creating an OTT series, saying, "I have a lot of pressure from my team to come up with a series, but I'm not in...race to do what everyone else is doing." The filmmaker noted that cinemas and OTT can co-exist, adding, "Films that are made for cinematic experience will surely hit the theatre first."

37.title: PM Modi to unveil 9.5-ft-tall Shivaji Maharaj's statue in Pune tomorrow
37.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will visit Pune tomorrow (Sunday) and will unveil the 9.5-foot-tall statue of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj at the PMC headquarters. During the visit, the PM will also inaugurate the two priority stretches of the Pune Metro rail project between Vanaz-Garware College and Pimpri Chinchwad-Swargate. PM Modi will also address the public at MIT College ground at Kothrud.

38.title: Grandmother refused to leave Ukraine house, wants to fight: Gehraiyaan intimacy director
38.article_body: Mumbai-based Ukrainian filmmaker Dar Gai, who was 'Gehraiyaan' intimacy director, spoke to ETimes about her family in Ukraine. "My parents...went to our village, which is...45 minutes away from Kyiv. My grandmother, who's 78, refused to leave...[saying], 'Who will fight here? I want to fight'," Dar stated. "It has been...hard, but...what gives me hope is the human spirit," she added.

39.title: ₹1,298.38 cr collected as green tax in 6 yrs from vehicles entering Delhi
39.article_body: Delhi municipal bodies collected ₹1,298.38 crore as Environmental Compensation Cess (ECC), also called green tax, from commercial vehicles entering the city from October 2015 to December 2021, as per government data. Of the total ECC fund, ₹281.51 crore has been utilised in five projects and ₹1,016 crore remains unspent. ECC fund was created to check air pollution levels in Delhi.

40.title: Stole socks from Batman set, was told 'How many socks do you need': Robert
40.article_body: Actor Robert Pattinson has revealed that he stole socks from the sets of 'The Batman', adding it was impossible to take anything home. "I kept getting told by Warner Brothers, like, 'You know, it's fine to have a few, but you take them every day. How many socks do you need? Because we've been shooting for a year'," Robert said.

41.title: Islamic State claims Pakistan bombing that killed 63 at mosque
41.article_body: The Islamic State said a lone Afghan suicide bomber had carried out the attack at a mosque in Pakistan's Peshawar on Friday, killing at least 63 people and injuring nearly 200 others. Pakistan's Information Minister Fawad Chaudhry said that three investigation teams have been established to study forensic evidence and closed-circuit TV footage to track down masterminds of the attack.

42.title: 5 members of family die as car falls into 200-ft-deep gorge in J&K, 1 injured
42.article_body: Five members of a family died and one person sustained injuries in a road accident that took place in Jammu and Kashmir's Samba on Saturday. Samba SHO said the family was travelling to Anantnag from Punjab's Amritsar when the car's driver suddenly lost control of the vehicle. The car fell into a gorge, which was around 200-feet deep, he added.

43.title: Kiara dances with sister Ishita at her pre-wedding festivities, shares video
43.article_body: Actress Kiara Advani took to Instagram Stories on Friday to share a video of her dancing with her sister Ishita Advani at one of her pre-wedding festivities. In the video, Kiara and Ishita can be seen dancing to The Sky Is Pink's song 'For Aisha'. Earlier, Kiara had shared pictures from Ishita's bachelorette party on her Instagram Stories.

44.title: Efforts on to bring Naveen's mortal remains from Ukraine: K'taka CM Bommai
44.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai said the government is making all efforts to bring the mortal remains of Naveen Shekharappa Gyanagoudar from Ukraine soon. Bommai said he will visit Naveen's residence in Haveri to console his family. The government has decided to provide compensation to his family as well. Naveen who studied MBBS in Ukraine died in shelling on Tuesday.

45.title: 1 dead, 11 hurt as bus carrying CISF jawans falls into gorge in UP
45.article_body: One CISF jawan died and 11 others were injured after a bus they were travelling in fell into a gorge in Uttar Pradesh's Markundi valley, police said on Saturday. The police added that the jawans had been travelling on election duty. "The driver lost control...and [bus] fell into a gorge after breaking the road railing," a police official said.

46.title: Bullock cart race cancelled in Punjab after authorities intervene
46.article_body: A bullock cart race was cancelled in a village in Punjab's Fatehgarh Sahib after the intervention of the district administration on Friday. A local animal welfare officer, Anil Kataria, alerted the administration and asked for its cancellation, saying that such races are banned by the Supreme Court. Later, the organisers tried to shift the tournament venue.

47.title: Our buses ready to evacuate Indian students, others from Ukraine: Russia to UN
47.article_body: Russia's Permanent Representative to the UN Ambassador Vassily Nebenzia has informed that Russian buses are ready at crossing points to go to the eastern Ukrainian cities of Kharkiv and Sumy to evacuate Indian students and other foreign nationals. "In the Belgorod region of Russia, 130 comfortable buses have been waiting (and standing ready) since 6:00 am today," Nebenzia stated.

48.title: I'm below average, people won't remember me 50yrs from now: Bhansali
48.article_body: Filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali in an interview has called himself "nothing special" and "a very below average human being". "Something is guiding me...protecting me and...making it possible for me to [make] 'Bajirao Mastani' and 'Padmaavat' and 'Ramleela'," he added. Bhansali further said that he doesn't think people will remember him 50 years from now but they will remember his work.

49.title: 66,224 have returned from abroad to fight in Ukraine: Defence Min
49.article_body: Ukraine's Defence Minister Oleksii Reznikov on Saturday said that 66,224 Ukrainian men had returned from abroad "at this moment to defend their Country" from the invading Russian forces. "These are 12 more combat and motivated brigades! Ukrainians, we are invincible," he added. Separately, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has urged foreigners to join its fight against Russian forces.

50.title: Virat Kohli gets guard of honour from teammates, pic goes viral
50.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli, who is playing his 100th Test, was given a guard of honour by his teammates when India were coming out to field against Sri Lanka in the first Test in Mohali. BCCI shared a picture on Twitter, writing, "Beauty of the sport." Kohli entered the field with his one hand raised.

51.title: Govt likes to indulge in PR: Tharoor on Minister's speeches over evacuation
51.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor appreciated the Central government for evacuating Indians from war-hit Ukraine but criticised it for indulging in 'PR exercise'. "This government has a problem... it likes to indulge PR exercise," said Tharoor. "A minister went to Romania and said that we are all doing this for you...why are you coming here and giving a speech?" he added.

52.title: Mother Dairy to hike milk prices by ₹2 per litre in Delhi-NCR from tomorrow
52.article_body: Mother Dairy on Saturday announced that it will hike milk prices by ₹2 per litre for all milk variants in Delhi-NCR from March 6. The company cited a rise in fuel costs, costs of packing material and procurement prices as the reason for it. Apart from this, Amul and Parag Milk Foods had also increased milk prices recently.

53.title: Sushmita shares hoarding saying 'How can you adopt without marriage?'
53.article_body: Actress Sushmita Sen on Friday shared a picture of a hoarding in Mumbai which says, "Bina shaadi ke child adopt kaise kar sakti ho (How can you adopt a child without marriage)?" She captioned her post, "Heard this one too many times before I decided to stop listening. Single mother by choice." Sushmita adopted her daughters in 2000 and 2010.

54.title: Over 11,000 Indian citizens evacuated from Ukraine so far: MoS V Muraleedharan
54.article_body: Over 11,000 Indian nationals have been evacuated from Ukraine amid war, Minister of State for External Affairs V Muraleedharan confirmed in a tweet on Saturday. "Operation Ganga is in full swing...Happy to have received a group of 170 Indians at New Delhi airport, evacuated through AirAsia India. Thank our Missions, foreign governments, and volunteers for their constant support," he added.

55.title: Raut alleges phone tapping of Opposition leaders ahead of poll results
55.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut accused BJP of tapping of phones of "several Opposition leaders in the states where elections are being held" and said that they got huge information about phone tapping of Goa leaders. He also mentioned ex-Pune Police Commissioner Rashmi Shukla against whom a case was registered recently for alleged involvement in phone tapping of Nana Patole.

56.title: Shane Warne's demise feels like a personal loss: Rahul Dravid
56.article_body: Condoling the demise of Shane Warne, Rahul Dravid said, "Even if you didn't meet him often, Warne could make it feel like this was personal and it really feels like a personal loss." "Playing with Warne as a colleague will...be one of the highlights of my cricketing career," added Dravid. Warne and Dravid played together for Rajasthan Royals.

57.title: Every player has set plans for Pakistan who have come prepared: Mithali
57.article_body: Discussing India Women's opening match of the 2022 Women's World Cup against Pakistan, ODI captain Mithali Raj said every player in the team has set plans for taking on Pakistan, who have come prepared. "We are equally prepared to put our best foot forward and we want to set a momentum going into the tournament," added Mithali.

58.title: Copyright case against Ed Sheeran's 2017 song Shape Of You begins
58.article_body: The case against singer-songwriter Ed Sheeran's 2017 song 'Shape of You' began in London High Court on Friday. The case alleges that the song infringes the copyright of Sami Switch's 2015 song 'Oh Why' as "particular lines and phrases" are similar to it. Sami claimed he sent his song to Ed's inner circle in a bid to work with him.

59.title: 4th Corporator quits BJP ahead of Pimpri-Chinchwad municipal polls
59.article_body: Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporator Maya Barne on Friday resigned from the civic body and the membership of the BJP, making her the fourth Corporator to quit the party in the last two weeks. The resignations have come ahead of civic body polls. "Massive corruption has taken place during the BJP regime...I was also fed up with...dictatorial attitude of some...leaders," she said.

60.title: Ukraine shares video of Russian military helicopter downed by its missile
60.article_body: Ukraine Defence Ministry has shared a video of Russian military helicopter being downed by its anti-aircraft system. "This is how the Russian occupiers are dying. This time in a helicopter! Glory to Ukraine and its defenders! Together to victory," the ministry tweeted with the video. This comes as Russia declared ceasefire in Ukraine to open humanitarian corridors for civilians.

61.title: Passengers push train coaches away from burning engine in UP, video viral
61.article_body: After a fire broke out in the engine and two coaches of the Saharanpur-Delhi passenger train on Saturday, passengers were seen pushing the rest of the compartments away from the burning engine and coaches. A video of the passengers separating the coaches to prevent the spread of the fire has also gone viral online. The incident took place in Meerut.

62.title: Meat of endangered sharks found in pet food: DNA study
62.article_body: Scientists have discovered the DNA of endangered sharks in packaged food being fed to cats and dogs. Based on the DNA study, researchers have found that several brands of pet food contained the meat of endangered species of sharks. These brands, however, only listed 'ocean fish' as an ingredient, making the consumers unknowingly contribute to the overfishing of shark populations.

63.title: Delhi Deputy CM Sisodia inaugurates swimming pools in 2 govt schools
63.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Saturday inaugurated new swimming pools in two Delhi government schools in Mayur Vihar and Mandawali. "CM Arvind Kejriwal is committed to providing world-class facilities to the students," he tweeted. The pool in the school in Mayur Vihar will be fully functional and open for all children from nearby schools from April 1, Sisodia added.

64.title: Man takes gold loan to pay earlier loan, cheats firm of ₹10 lakh in Pune
64.article_body: A man has been booked for allegedly cheating a Pune-based private financial service provider company of ₹10.20 lakh. The accused had taken a loan from the company and promised to mortgage the gold against that. However, he used the loan amount to pay off another gold loan he'd, leaving the current company short of ₹10,20,658 and the gold, said police.

65.title: Pic shows couple kissing through fence as wife waits to board evacuation train in Ukraine
65.article_body: A picture shows a husband kissing his wife goodbye through a train platform fence as she waits to board an evacuation train with their 11-month-old son in Ukraine. They had escaped heavy overnight fighting in Bucha and Irpin. Male citizens of Ukraine aged 18 to 60 are prohibited from leaving the country amid war with Russia.

66.title: Extraordinary times: Musk calls for boost in oil & gas output amid Russia-Ukraine war
66.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Saturday called for an increase in oil and gas output as "extraordinary times demand extraordinary measures." Musk wrote, "Hate to say it, but we need to increase oil & gas output immediately…Obviously, this would negatively affect Tesla, but sustainable energy solutions simply cannot react instantaneously to make up for Russian oil and gas exports."

67.title: Set worth ₹1.75 cr erected in Mumbai for Bhansali's 'Heeramandi': Reports
67.article_body: A set worth ₹1.75 crore has been erected in Mumbai's Filmcity for Sanjay Leela Bhansali's upcoming web show 'Heeramandi', as per reports. The historical drama, which will feature Sonakshi Sinha and Aditi Rao Hydari, will reportedly go on floors by the end of this month. The forthcoming project will also star Huma Qureshi and Manisha Koirala, as per reports.

68.title: Haas F1 team terminates Russian driver Nikita Mazepin's contract
68.article_body: Haas F1 team has terminated Russian driver Nikita Mazepin's contract. It has also terminated the title partnership of Uralkali, a Russian potash fertilizer producer and exporter company. "As with the rest of the Formula 1 community, the team is shocked and saddened by the invasion of Ukraine and wishes for a swift and peaceful end to the conflict," it tweeted.

69.title: Ukrainian married to Kashmiri man urges PM Modi to help her country
69.article_body: A Ukrainian woman named Oliza has urged PM Modi and the Indian government to help her conflict-torn country in every possible way. Oliza is married to a Kashmiri man and lives in Pulwama. "Today, our country is fighting for democracy and peace. They have independence in their heart and won't let Russia come and stay in our homes," she said.

70.title: Ericsson, CEO sued in US over possible dealings with ISIS in Iraq
70.article_body: Swedish firm Ericsson, its CEO and CFO have been sued in the US for misleading investors about the company's dealings in Iraq, a filing revealed. The firm revealed last month that an internal investigation showed its possible involvement in the payments to ISIS. Ericsson has called the allegations against it and its officers false and misleading.

71.title: B'luru police arrests 2 for providing fake SIM cards to fraudster
71.article_body: Bengaluru City DCP (North East Division) Anoop A Shetty on Friday said that two people have been arrested for allegedly providing fake SIM cards to a fraudster. He also warned people against providing multiple copies of documents while purchasing SIM cards. Furthermore, he also urged people to be careful if a sales executive asked for their fingerprint more than once.

72.title: We took one day at a time: Urvashi Rautela on shooting in Ukraine
72.article_body: Urvashi Rautela, who was shooting for a film in Ukraine's Kyiv and Odesa, flew back to India two days before Russia launched a military operation in Ukraine. "While we were shooting, there was a lot of tension between both the countries...But we took one day at a time," she said. Urvashi further said the situation in Ukraine is "really terrifying".

73.title: CRED loss widens to ₹524 crore in FY21, revenue jumps to ₹95 crore
73.article_body: Entrepreneur Kunal Shah-founded fintech startup CRED's losses widened by 45% year-on-year to ₹524 crore for the financial year ending March 31, 2021, compared to ₹360 crore a year ago. Its revenue jumped from ₹18.16 crore in FY20 to ₹95.53 crore in FY21. During this period, CRED spent ₹222 crore on marketing, up 289% from ₹57 crore in the previous year.

74.title: South Korean wildfire destroys 159 homes, forces 6,200 to flee
74.article_body: Thousands of South Korean firefighters and troops are battling a large wildfire that has spread across more than 6,000 hectares (almost 15,000 acres). The fire, which began on Friday morning, has reportedly destroyed at least 159 homes and 46 other buildings and prompted the evacuation of over 6,200 people. There were no immediate reports of injuries or deaths.

75.title: Over 1,200 hospitalised after eating food at wedding of Cong leader's son in Guj
75.article_body: Over 1,200 people fell ill and had to be hospitalised after they consumed food at the wedding function of a local Congress leader's son in a village in Gujarat's Mehsana district, police said. "People started vomiting and complained of diarrhoea...They were rushed to different hospitals," Mehsana SP said. Samples of the food have been collected for further examination, he added.

76.title: Warne would talk about cricket even at parties: Mohammad Kaif
76.article_body: Talking about Australian spin legend Shane Warne, Mohammad Kaif said Warne would take players like Ravindra Jadeja to parties while leading Rajasthan Royals, but would talk about cricket even during parties. "I am numb, I don't have words to express my feelings. It is very, very shocking," added Kaif. Warne passed away at the age of 52.

77.title: Pic shows Ukrainian soldier carrying baby to safety after bridge gets destroyed
77.article_body: An image shows a baby being cradled by a soldier near a scene of destruction amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The baby has been pictured near a blown up bridge with rubble, twisted metal and cables lying in water and mud in the town of Irpin, near Kyiv, after shelling. Apartment blocks and vehicles were also blown up in Irpin.

78.title: Musk mocks Russia's 'let US fly to space on broomsticks' remark with SpaceX launch
78.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk mocked Russia after the country said it would stop providing rocket engines to the US in retaliation to sanctions. "Let them fly on something else, their broomsticks, I don't know what," Russian space agency's chief Dmitry Rogozin had said. Commenting on a video of SpaceX launching 47 Starlink satellites into orbit, Musk wrote, "American broomstick."

79.title: Assam police arrest 5 with links to outfit affiliated with Al-Qaeda
79.article_body: Assam's Barpeta Police have arrested five persons for their alleged links to a jihadi outfit based in Bangladesh which is affiliated with Al-Qaeda in the Indian Subcontinent, a press release said on Saturday.  The accused had the "view to develop Barpeta as a base for jihadi work", it added. Incriminating documents and devices were also seized, it further said.

80.title: I'm in Kyiv, working: Zelenskyy shares video after Russia claims he fled to Poland
80.article_body: Reacting to Russian media reports that claimed he had fled the country, Ukrainian President  Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Saturday posted a video on Instagram from his office in Kyiv. Sharing the video, Zelenskyy wrote, "I am in Kyiv. I am working here. No one has escaped anywhere." Russian politician Vyacheslav Volodin had claimed that Zelenskyy had escaped to Poland.

81.title: Parts of Pune's Karve, Paud Road to be closed amid PM Modi's visit
81.article_body: Portions of Pune's Karve Road and Paud Road will be closed between 10 am to 2 pm amid PM Narendra Modi's visit on Sunday, orders issued by DCP (Traffic) Rahul Shrirame stated. Vehicles coming from Kothrud via Karve Road will be diverted at Tilak chowk, while those coming towards Deccan area from Shivtirth Nagar will be diverted at Mayur Colony.

82.title: Engine, 2 coaches of UP-Delhi passenger train gutted in fire; no injuries reported
82.article_body: The engine and two coaches of a passenger train en route to Delhi from Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur were gutted in fire on Saturday morning. No casualties or injuries were reported in the incident, which took place at Daurala railway station near Meerut. A video footage purportedly showed passengers pushing the train to separate it from the coaches affected by fire.

83.title: CBI court refuses anticipatory bail to ex-NSE chief Chitra Ramkrishna
83.article_body: A special CBI court has dismissed the anticipatory bail of former NSE chief executive Chitra Ramkrishna in connection with the NSE co-location case. Accused of sharing information with a 'Himalayan yogi', the court said that no grounds were made out to grant anticipatory bail to Ramkrishna. It is reported that the CBI argued against granting protection to her.

84.title: India declare at 574/8 against Sri Lanka with Ravindra Jadeja not out on 175
84.article_body: India declared their first innings in the first Test at 574/8 with all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja batting at 175*(228). Jadeja and Mohammad Shami shared an unbeaten ninth-wicket partnership of 103 runs. Rishabh Pant, Ravichandran Ashwin and Hanuma Vihari scored fifties for India, while Virat Kohli, playing in his 100th Test, registered 45(76) in the first innings.

85.title: BJP seeks votes on the basis of lies: Rahul Gandhi
85.article_body: Addressing a rally in Varanasi, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Friday attacked PM Modi and said he claims to protect Hinduism but he protects lies. "I respect you all enough to never lie on your faces. They (Bharatiya Janata Party) do not seek votes on the name of the Hindu religion, but on the basis of lies," he said.

86.title: Local BJP leader held in Chhattisgarh for assaulting journalist in Durg
86.article_body: Police arrested a local BJP leader in Chhattisgarh for allegedly assaulting a journalist, identified as Dhirendra Giri Goswami, in the Durg district. The alleged assault took place in a colony under the Amleshwar Police Station area on Thursday night, police said. "Some unidentified person hit Goswami on his head with a sharp-edged weapon and injured him," the FIR states.

87.title: Man held for blackmailing woman with nude photos, videos in B'luru
87.article_body: A 31-year-old man was arrested for allegedly blackmailing women with their nude selfie videos and photos in Bengaluru. As per police, the accused would give missed calls to women and trap them into a relationship by talking sweet once they called him back. He would then film their intimate moments and blackmail them for money.

88.title: Crime reporter killed in Mexico; 7th to be murdered this year
88.article_body: A crime reporter was shot and killed in Mexico's Zacatecas on Friday, officials said. Juan Muniz, who also worked as a taxi driver, was reportedly shot in the head while driving passengers. Zacatecas' Governor, David Monreal, condemned the killing and asked police to "find those guilty as quickly as possible". So far, seven media workers have been killed in Mexico.

89.title: 11 Pune hospitals owe ₹12 lakh to 25 COVID-19 patients; PMC issues notices
89.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has issued show-cause notices to at least 11 private hospitals in the city for not refunding the excess amount charged to COVID-19 patients. According to officials, at least 25 patients have to be reimbursed over ₹12 lakh. These bills were audited by the civic body for patients admitted between May and November last year.

90.title: Australia defeat defending champions England in their 2022 Women's World Cup opener
90.article_body: Australia defeated defending champions England by 12 runs in their first match at 2022 Women's World Cup. Australia opener Rachael Haynes scored her career-best 130 runs off 131 deliveries to help her team post a total of 310/3. Alana King picked up three wickets, while Tahila McGrath took two wickets as England were restricted to 298/8 in their 50 overs.

91.title: PayPal shuts services in Russia, condemns it for violent aggression
91.article_body: US-based payments company PayPal has announced that it has shut down its services in Russia amid its ongoing invasion of Ukraine. PayPal CEO said the firm "stands with the international community in condemning Russia's violent military aggression in Ukraine". PayPal had stopped accepting new users in the country on Wednesday. It will support withdrawals "for a period of time".

92.title: Will challenge EC in SC over fund payment before Manipur polls: Cong
92.article_body: Senior Congress leader Jairam Ramesh accused Election Commission of helping BJP in the Manipur polls and said that he will file a petition in the Supreme Court challenging the EC's decision. He opposed EC's decision of not considering BJP-led Manipur government's payment of funds to the banned militant groups before the state polls as violation of Model Code of Conduct.

93.title: Mumbai doctor trying to recharge OTT platform loses ₹1.80 lakh to cyber fraudster
93.article_body: A doctor from Mumbai lost ₹1.80 lakh to a cyber fraudster while trying to recharge an OTT platform. Police said the victim received a reminder email from an unknown email address when the OTT platform's recharge period expired. She clicked on a link and was asked to fill in her bank details and OTP, following which she lost the money.

94.title: Shane Warne condemned Russia's attack on Ukraine as 'unjustified' days before demise
94.article_body: Days before his demise, former Australian cricketer Shane Warne criticised Russia's invasion of Ukraine, calling it an "unprovoked and unjustified" attack in a tweet. "The pictures are horrific and I can't believe more is not being done to stop this," he wrote. Tagging Ukrainian football manager Andriy Shevchenko, Warne said, "Sending lots of love to my Ukrainian mate...and his family."

95.title: If you were friends with Warne, they didn't sledge: Kumble on Australia's 'untold secret'
95.article_body: Recalling an "untold secret" of Australian team involving Shane Warne, Anil Kumble said, "When you went out to bat...and if you were friends with Warne, you didn't get any banter from the Australians." Kumble added, "So when I went to bat...Aussies didn't need to do any banter to unsettle me. That was Warnie...that was how he looked after his friends."

96.title: Mumbai Monorail to be linked with Colaba-Seepz Metro-3 line at Mahalaxmi
96.article_body: The Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) is planning to connect the Mumbai Monorail corridor with the Colaba-Seepz underground Metro-3 line. According to reports, the Chembur-Jacob Circle Monorail corridor will be extended by about 500 metres to link it with Mahalaxmi Metro Station. The extension is expected to improve the connectivity in Mahalaxmi, Parel and Wadala areas.

97.title: Govt proposes 10% tree cover for residential, commercial construction sites
97.article_body: The Centre has proposed that at least one tree be planted in every 80 square metres of land in order to ensure residential and commercial construction sites have at least 10% of their area under green cover. The draft rules will apply to old as well as new buildings having a built-up area of or greater than 5,000 square metres.

98.title: Who is Alex, the Russian entrepreneur behind 'Wanted: dead or alive' post on Putin?
98.article_body: Russian entrepreneur Alex Konanykhin, whose 'Wanted: dead or alive' post on Russian President Vladimir Putin went viral, moved to the US in 1992 with his family. Alex, whom Russia had accused of embezzling money, is a former banker who now heads several technology companies. His company's website claims he established Russia's largest bank by the age of 25.

99.title: Singapore sanctions 4 Russian banks; bans military goods, computers export
99.article_body: Singapore announced sanctions against Russia over its "unprovoked attack" on Ukraine, becoming one of the few Southeast Asian nations to do so. It includes a ban on dealing with four Russian banks and an export ban on electronics, computers and military items. The sanctions "aim to constrain Russia's capacity to conduct war" and engage in "cyber aggression", Foreign Ministry said.

100.title: Jadeja breaks record for highest-ever Test score by an Indian batting at no. 7
100.article_body: All-rounder Ravindra Jadeja has broken the record for registering the highest Test score by an Indian batting at number seven. Jadeja achieved the feat after reaching 168 runs with a six in India's first innings in the first Test against Sri Lanka. The previous record was set by Kapil Dev, who scored 163 runs against Sri Lanka in 1986.

101.title: Aditya Thackeray inaugurates AkshyaChaitanya kitchen; to serve 6,500 kids
101.article_body: Maharashtra Minister Aditya Thackeray inaugurated the AkshyaChaitanya kitchen on Friday. Located in Byculla, this kitchen will serve nutritious breakfast every day to more than 6,500 school kids in BMC schools and 1,800 meals to families of patients in various Govt hospitals in Mumbai. "We will scale this service up, to serve all schools with nutritious breakfast," Thackeray said.

102.title: Remove late CM Arjun Singh's statue from road in Bhopal: HC to MP govt
102.article_body: Madhya Pradesh HC ordered the state government to remove late CM Arjun Singh's statue from a trijunction in Bhopal. It also ordered the removal of all statues in public utility places erected since January 18, 2013. A petition had argued that Singh's statue was erected at the place where a statue of freedom fighter Chandrashekhar Azad earlier stood.

103.title: Was offered cop roles, negative roles due to my short hair: Mandira
103.article_body: Mandira Bedi revealed that she was offered "at least 10 cop roles" and "at least 5-6 negative roles" because of her short hair. "Just think about it, either...cop or...negative character...Now, people cast me to play...strong modern woman so short hair means a lot of things," Mandira said, adding, "I like short hair...and I'll keep it as long as I want."

104.title: Indian politicians mourn demise of legendary spinner Shane Warne
104.article_body: Several Indian politicians including NCP chief Sharad Pawar, Union minister Nitin Gadkari and Congress leader Sachin Pilot mourned the demise of Australian spin legend Shane Warne. Pawar, who was the ICC President from 2010 to 2012, said, "The world today has lost one of the greatest cricketing heroes of all time." Pilot called Warne "a true performer and entertainer".

105.title: Meta pauses all ads in Russia, blocks Russian advertisers globally
105.article_body: Facebook-parent Meta has paused all ads in Russia and blocked Russian advertisers from running ads anywhere in the world amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "Due to the difficulties of operating in Russia at this time, ads targeting people in Russia will be paused," the company said. Earlier, Russia blocked Facebook, citing 26 cases of "discrimination against Russian media".

106.title: School girl raped & forced to take poison by senior, dies in UP
106.article_body: A 16-year-old Dalit girl has died after she was allegedly raped and later forced to consume poison by a senior at her school in Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur. According to the police, the deceased was lured by the senior under the pretext of buying her gifts. The girl was reportedly found in a field in a semi-naked and unconscious state.

107.title: I'm just crying, can start crying from nothing: Ukrainian footballer Zinchenko
107.article_body: Sharing the impact of the Russian invasion of Ukraine on him, Manchester City's Ukrainian footballer Oleksandr Zinchenko said he is just crying and can start crying from "nothing". "I'll be honest, if not for my...family, I would be there," added Zinchenko. "I am surprised that not one Russian top footballer has said anything. They just ignore it," stated Zinchenko.

108.title: Russian economy headed for deep recession, may face 1998-like crisis: JPMorgan
108.article_body: JPMorgan & Chase's economists said the Russian economy "now looks headed for a deep recession" following sanctions by Western countries. They expect Russia's GDP to contract 7% this year as compared to a 5.3% contraction in the 1998 debt crisis. A peak-to trough decline in Russian GDP is now expected "at around 12%, comparable to 1998 (~10%) crisis", economists added.

109.title: China sets lowest GDP growth target in over 30 years at 5.5%
109.article_body: World's second largest economy China has set a GDP growth target of around 5.5% this year, the slowest pace in more than three decades. Chinese Premier Li Keqiang said in his government work report, "Our country will encounter many more risks and challenges." The country will spend 7.1% more on defence this year, outpacing the government's economic growth forecast.

110.title: Rodney set standards for wicketkeeping at unattainable level: Kapil Dev
110.article_body: Kapil Dev took to Instagram to condole the demise of ex-Australia wicketkeeper Rodney Marsh and Shane Warne, stating that Rodney set the standards for wicketkeeping at an almost unattainable level. "Shane, you lived your life king size," added Kapil in his post. "Stunned and miserable. Will miss you Warnie. Will...treasure our on field duels," read a tweet from Sachin Tendulkar.

111.title: Container truck crashes into houses in Maha; residents narrowly escape
111.article_body: Residents had a narrow escape after an overspeeding container truck crashed into two houses and a shop in Maharashtra's Kolad along the Mumbai-Goa Highway. "The container went at least 10 feet inside and caused major structural damage to both the houses and the shop," a police official said. The driver was injured and is undergoing treatment at a hospital.

112.title: Mobile phone theft leads to shootout with Delhi Police, 2 held
112.article_body: Two men have been arrested for allegedly snatching a man's mobile phone and firing at the police in Delhi. The police laid a trap to catch the suspects, who earlier managed to escape after snatching a mobile phone. The suspects fired on police after getting trapped and during return fire, one got injured. Both were arrested after the shootout.

113.title: Gujarat shopkeeper chokes girl to death, attempts suicide in hotel room
113.article_body: A 21-year-old shopkeeper from Gujarat's Kutch was booked for allegedly choking a girl to death using packaging tape inside a hotel room in Rajkot. Later, the accused attempted suicide before he was rushed to a hospital, where his condition is stated to be critical. "Apparently, the couple was into some relationship, but somehow things went awry," an officer said.

114.title: Tesla German Gigafactory gets conditional approval for production
114.article_body: Tesla's Gigafactory near Berlin has received a conditional go-ahead, ending months of delay. However, Tesla cannot start production right away. The licence is subject to a public objection period as well as other final inspection conditions that include air pollution control and water usage. Tesla intends to produce up to 5,00,000 vehicles per year at the plant.

115.title: Russia declares ceasefire in Ukraine to open humanitarian corridors
115.article_body: Russia has declared ceasefire in Ukraine to open humanitarian corridors for civilians. Russian military said it is halting its offensive so residents can leave Mariupol and Volnovakha. Following the second round of negotiations between the two countries, a Ukrainian official had said that Russia agreed on humanitarian corridors to evacuate civilians.

116.title: Thai man jailed for putting a sticker on King's portrait during protest
116.article_body: A court in Thailand on Friday sentenced a 33-year-old man to two years in prison for insulting the monarchy, his lawyers said. Narin Kulpongsathorn was allegedly found guilty of putting a sticker bearing the logo of a political satire Facebook page on a large portrait of King Maha Vajiralongkorn outside the Supreme Court during a political rally in 2020.

117.title: 'Game of Thrones' actor John Stahl passes away aged 68
117.article_body: 'Game of Thrones' actor John Stahl has passed away aged 68, his agent said in a statement. He died on Isle of Lewis in Scotland on March 2 and is survived by his wife, Jane Paton, the statement read. John Stahl played Rickard Karstark in 'Game of Thrones' and was also known for playing Inverdarroch in 'Take The High Road'.

118.title: B'luru police file charge sheet against 11 in Bitcoin drugs case
118.article_body: Bengaluru police have filed a charge sheet against 11 people, including a hacker called 'Sriki', in a case regarding the purchase of drugs from dark web using Bitcoin. The case had brought to light other cases involving 'Sriki', like the ₹11.5 crore cybertheft from the Karnataka e-governance cell in 2019. A former MLA's son is also accused in the case.

119.title: Masked persons hurl crude bomb outside expelled BJP leader's house in Manipur
119.article_body: Two masked persons hurled a crude bomb outside the residence of expelled BJP leader Chongtham Bijoy Singh in Lamphel area of Manipur's Imphal West on Friday night, according to police. Nobody was injured in the blast triggered by the miscreants, who came in a two-wheeler vehicle, police added. "The attack might be a threat...to make me politically silent," Bijoy said.

120.title: IAF postpones Exercise Vayu Shakti 2022 to be held in Raj on March 7
120.article_body: Indian Air Force (IAF) has postponed Exercise Vayu Shakti 2022 which was scheduled to be held in Rajasthan on March 7, officials said. PM Narendra Modi and Defence Minister Rajnath Singh were scheduled to attend the exercise, in which Rafale aircraft was slated to participate for the first time. The Defence Ministry had earlier announced postponing of DefExpo 2022.

121.title: Paragliding, balloon flights restricted ahead of PM Modi's Pune visit
121.article_body: Pune's district administration has restricted all paragliding activities and balloon flights ahead of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to the district. As per an order issued by District Collector Rajesh Deshmukh, the restriction will last till midnight on March 6. The order states that action will be taken against the violators under Section 188 of the Indian Penal Code.

122.title: Shocking: SC on Punjab & Haryana HC granting protection to ex-DGP
122.article_body: Commenting on Punjab and Haryana HC order, which granted protection from arrest to former Punjab Director General of Police (DGP) Sumedh Singh Saini, Supreme Court said it was "shocked". "How can future course of action be stayed?" SC added. HC granted protection to Saini in pending cases, except Balwant Singh Multani murder case, and cases likely to be registered.

123.title: I wanted a sibling for Vir, wanted a little daughter: Mandira on adopting Tara
123.article_body: Mandira Bedi, in an interview, opened up on her decision to adopt Tara and said that she "wanted a little daughter" and a sibling for her son, Vir. "I love making her hair and putting bows in her hair and dressing her up. It feels like I've got a little doll to play with. She's so cute...and adorable," Mandira added.

124.title: N Korea fires suspected ballistic missile into sea, 9th test this year
124.article_body: North Korea on Saturday fired a suspected ballistic missile into the sea off its east coast, South Korea and Japan said. This is Pyongyang's ninth missile test so far this year. South Korean military said the projectile reached a height of 560 km and flew a distance of 270 km. The launch comes days before South Korea's Presidential election.

125.title: 2 killed in poll-related violence in Manipur as voting for Assembly elections underway
125.article_body: Two people were killed in separate incidents of poll-related violence in Manipur as voting is underway for the second and last phase of state Assembly elections on Saturday. The first incident took place in Thoubal district and the second in Senapati. The last phase of the 2022 Manipur Assembly polls has 92 candidates contesting across 22 Assembly constituencies.

126.title: What was the greatest India XI picked by Shane Warne?
126.article_body: Shane Warne, who passed away aged 52, had picked greatest India XI in 2020, which included players he played against in international career. He had named Sourav Ganguly as captain and picked Virender Sehwag and Navjot Singh Sidhu as openers. Other players included Rahul Dravid, Sachin Tendulkar, Mohammed Azharuddin, Kapil Dev, Nayan Mongia, Harbhajan Singh, Anil Kumble and Javagal Srinath.

127.title: Ravindra Jadeja smashes Test hundred after over 3 years, does sword-wielding celebration
127.article_body: Team India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja smashed his second Test hundred after reaching the three-figure mark off 160 deliveries on the second day of the first Test against Sri Lanka in Mohali. Jadeja did the sword-wielding celebration after reaching his hundred. His first Test hundred had come against West Indies in October 2018.

128.title: BMC allots land for 'Dabbawala Bhavan' in Bandra
128.article_body: The BMC general body approved the 'Dabbawala Bhavan' project in Bandra with Mumbai Mayor Kishori Pednekar handing over the land to the President of Mumbai Tiffin Box Suppliers Association (Dabbawale), Ramdas Karwande. The Bhavan was first proposed by the Shiv Sena in its 2017 BMC election manifesto. However, it was kept aside due to non-availability of land in the city.

129.title: Won't do so unless at gunpoint: Elon Musk on Starlink blocking Russian news sources
129.article_body: World's richest person and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk wrote on Twitter, "Starlink has been told by some governments (not Ukraine) to block Russian news sources." "We will not do so unless at gunpoint. Sorry to be a free speech absolutist," he said. In an earlier tweet, he wrote, "My sympathies to the...people of Russia, who do want this (war)."

130.title: People pay respects with beers and cigarettes at Warne's statue in Australia
130.article_body: People paid their respects at the base of a statue of former Australian cricket great Shane Warne at the Melbourne Cricket Ground with flowers, beers and cigarettes. Warne passed away at the age of 52 in Thailand. "It was pretty devastating to lose a childhood hero," said a man who came to the MCG to pay his respects.

131.title: I would probably be in jail if I did that: Serena on Zverev's outburst against umpire
131.article_body: Reacting to Alexander Zverev being thrown out of a tournament last month for smashing racquet against the umpire's chair, Serena Williams said, "There is absolutely a double standard...I'd probably be in jail if I did that." Notably, Serena was placed on probation for two years by Grand Slam committee for a "major offence of aggravated behaviour" at US Open 2009.

132.title: K'taka CM proposes freeing temples from govt control in state Budget
132.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister BS Bommai while presenting the state Budget on Friday proposed to free temples from government control by giving autonomy to those coming under the Endowment department. "Necessary legal action will be taken to delegate the discretion of developmental works to the temples," Bommai said. A total of 34,563 temples in Karnataka comes under the Endowment Department.

133.title: 6 arrested for shooting two realtors dead on Hyderabad outskirts
133.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Thursday arrested six accused in connection with the murder of two realtors on the outskirts of the city. "The motive behind the realtors' murder case is land disputes," said Mahesh Bhagwat, Rachakonda Commissioner of Police. According to police, main accused, Matta Reddy, had hatched the murder conspiracy along with his watchman by procuring firearms from Bihar.

134.title: Breathalyser tests to check drunk driving resume in Gurugram after 2 years
134.article_body: After being paused due to the fear of the spread of COVID-19 in March 2020, breathalyser tests resumed to check drunk driving in Gurugram on Friday. The city police have decided to resume the tests a day after the Golf Course Road accident in which four employees of a restaurant were killed by a speeding vehicle.

135.title: Entire world will pay the price if Russia-Ukraine war continues: Rajnath Singh
135.article_body: Addressing a public rally in Uttar Pradesh's Chandauli, Indian Defence Minister Rajnath Singh warned if the war between Russia and Ukraine continues it'll cause more trouble. "Most nations that import oil, gas from Russia...US has imposed sanctions on Russia...If their economies are affected, the entire world will have to pay the price and India will not be spared," he said.

136.title: Medical students who returned from Ukraine can complete internship in India: NMC
136.article_body: The National Medical Commission (NMC) has said that medical students who have returned to India from Ukraine due to the war can complete their internship in India after clearing Foreign Medical Graduate Examination. "Considering the agony and stress faced by these foreign medical graduates, their application to complete the remaining part of internship in India is considered eligible," NMC added.

137.title: Relay room catches fire at Pune's Dapodi Rly Station; no one hurt
137.article_body: The relay room at Pune's Dapodi Railway Station caught fire at 7.15 pm on Friday and affected the movement of five trains on the Pune-Mumbai route for 40 minutes, according to a railway spokesperson. Officials said that no one was injured in the fire which was extinguished in half an hour. The reason behind the fire is to be ascertained.

138.title: Mob attacks police, torches vehicle after woman dies in accident in WB
138.article_body: A police team was allegedly attacked by a mob after a woman died in an accident at Digha-Nandakumar national highway in West Bengal's Daisai town. They also set a vehicle on fire and vandalised the police car. The woman died on the spot after a passenger pick-up van that she was travelling in collided with a dumper truck on Friday.

139.title: 4 sexual assault cases against Kochi tattoo artist after 18-yr-old alleges rape
139.article_body: Days after an 18-year-old girl, in a social media post, alleged she was raped in a popular tattoo studio in Kerala's Kochi, police registered four sexual assault cases against the tattoo artist. Kochi Police Commissioner said four women came forward to register formal complaints after enough persuasion. "We have some clues about the accused. He'll be arrested soon," he added.

140.title: Don't let Putin turn Ukraine into Syria: Ukrainian Foreign Min to NATO
140.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba attended a meeting of NATO Foreign Ministers on Friday and urged the military alliance to act now before it's "too late". "Don't let Putin turn Ukraine into Syria," he said.  "We are ready to fight. We will continue fighting, but we need partners to help us with concrete, resolute and swift actions, now," he added.

141.title: Drone movement detected along IB in Raj, J&K in separate incidents
141.article_body: BSF has opened fire at two drones along International Border (IB) in Rajasthan's Sri Ganganagar and Jammu and Kashmir's (J&K) Arnia in separate incidents. Drone movement was detected in Sri Ganganagar between Friday and Saturday, while in Arnia it was around 4.10am on Saturday. Earlier, J&K police seized an arms cache allegedly dropped by a Pakistani drone in Treva.

142.title: Death toll from blast at illegal firecracker unit in Bihar rises to 14; SHO suspended
142.article_body: The death toll from the explosion at a house in Bihar's Bhagalpur has reached 14. Police suspect that the occupants of the house were illegally manufacturing firecrackers. Bhagalpur SSP said a Special Investigation Team (SIT) has been constituted to investigate the case. Tatarpur SHO has been suspended on charges of dereliction of duty.

143.title: Haryana introduces Bill to stop 'forcible' conversions amid protests
143.article_body: Haryana government on Friday introduced the Prevention of Unlawful Conversion of Religion Bill, 2022 in the Legislative Assembly amid protests from the Opposition. A Congress MLA tore a copy of the Bill after it was introduced by state Home Minister Anil Vij. "The Bill does not discriminate against any religion...meant to prevent only 'forcible conversions'," CM Manohar Lal Khattar said.

144.title: Private schools in Chandigarh allowed 8% fee hike for 2022-23 session
144.article_body: The Chandigarh administration has allowed private unaided schools in the UT to impose an 8% hike in the upcoming 2022-2023 session. "Private schools must not raise their fees this year as well," Chandigarh Parents' Association said. Earlier, in June 2020, the administration had directed private unaided schools to charge only tuition fees and not increase fees for the 2020-2021 session.

145.title: We are too critical of Kohli, he was in absolute control: Gambhir
145.article_body: Discussing Virat Kohli's 45 in the first innings of India's opening Test against Sri Lanka, Gautam Gambhir said we are "too critical" of Kohli at times, adding that he was in "absolute control" before being dismissed. "Even if he plays one bad shot, we say lapse in concentration," stated Gambhir. Kohli was dismissed by Lasith Embuldeniya.

146.title: Russian soldiers raping women in occupied cities: Ukraine
146.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba has said Russian soldiers are raping women in occupied cities. "When bombs fall on your cities, when soldiers rape women in occupied cities...it's difficult of course to speak about efficiency of international law," he added. "Russia, as a country that committed an act of aggression, will be held accountable for its deeds," he further said.

147.title: Thousands left without internet after cyberattack in Europe
147.article_body: Thousands of European users have been left without internet after a cyberattack reportedly took place at the start of Russia's invasion in Ukraine. According to Orange, nearly 9,000 subscribers of its service in France are without internet after a "cyber event" on February 24 at US satellite operator Viasat. French Space Commander General Michel Friedling confirmed the cyberattack on Viasat.

148.title: Hate to say it, but we need to increase oil, gas output: Tesla CEO Musk
148.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to discuss the need to increase oil and gas output, saying, "Hate to say it, but we need to increase oil & gas output immediately." He acknowledged the move would "negatively affect Tesla", however, he further said, "Sustainable energy solutions simply cannot react instantaneously to make up for Russian oil & gas exports."

149.title: Russia's 4th richest person's ₹543 crore superyacht seized by Italy
149.article_body: Italian authorities have detained the superyacht of Russian billionaire Alexey Mordashov, who was recently sanctioned by European Union, in the coastal city of Imperia. The 56-year-old Chairman of Russian steel industry firm Severstal is Russia's fourth richest person with a $20.1 billion fortune, as per Bloomberg. His 215-foot yacht named 'Lady M' is worth €65 million (₹543 crore).

150.title: Alia Bhatt's 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' earns ₹100 crore worldwide
150.article_body: Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' has crossed the ₹100 crore mark worldwide in the first week of its release. The film has earned ₹108.3 crore so far at the worldwide box office, Bhansali Productions shared on Friday. According to film trade analyst Taran Adarsh, the Sanjay Leela Bhansali directorial has earned ₹68.93 crore in India so far.

151.title: No idea what’s going on in Pant's head but he is a must watch: Vaughan
151.article_body: Terming Rishabh Pant as the "greatest" modern day entertainer, ex-England captain Michael Vaughan tweeted he has no idea what's going on in Pant's head but he is always a must watch. "I don't want to miss a ball he faces," added Vaughan in his tweet. Pant scored 96 runs in the first innings of India's Mohali Test against Sri Lanka.

152.title: Fight erupts between students over hijab issue at Mangaluru college
152.article_body: Two complaints were filed after a fight erupted between a group of male students and female students over hijab issue on Friday at a college in Karnataka's Mangaluru. A day before, five hijab-wearing students weren't allowed to give their exams after a few students objected and when the former returned the next day the fight erupted, a police official said.

153.title: He once was an enemy on the pitch, became a great friend off it: Vaughan on Warne
153.article_body: Former England captain Michael Vaughan, while condoling Shane Warne's demise, said that Warne once was his enemy on the pitch, but became a great friend off it. "Shane was the greatest ever cricketer but more than that his character lit up every dressing room, commentary box, bar, golf club and friendship group," he added.

154.title: Taliban praises wheat sent by India, says 'Pakistan gave rotten, inedible wheat'
154.article_body: The Taliban has criticised Pakistan for donating poor quality wheat to Afghanistan as it praised the quality of wheat sent by India. "Wheat donated by Pakistan is rotten and inedible," a Taliban official said. Last month, India sent 50 trucks stacked with around 2,500 tons of wheat to Afghanistan to help relieve food shortages.

155.title: 3,200 ganja laced chocolates seized in Bengaluru, 2 arrested
155.article_body: The Mahadevapura Police arrested two people who hailed from Odisha on Friday for being involved in the supply of ganja laced chocolates to Bengaluru. The police seized 3,200 such chocolates weighing 18 kg. On Wednesday, the Bengaluru's Railway Protection Force (RPF) had seized 7.1 kg of ganja worth ₹4,26,000 at Banaswadi Railway Station under its operation NARCOS.

156.title: Shooting stones block Jammu-Srinagar National Highway
156.article_body: After being blocked on Thursday due to the landslides, the Jammu-Srinagar National Highway was blocked again on Saturday, this time due to shooting stones. The J&K Traffic Police said that the highway has been blocked at Panthyal and vehicular movement will be suspended until the clearance work completes. The highway connects Kashmir with the rest of India.

157.title: Greenlight to bombing: Zelenskyy on NATO rejecting no-fly zone request
157.article_body: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy condemned NATO's decision to rule out the implementation of a no-fly zone over his country. "Knowing that new strikes and casualties are inevitable, NATO deliberately decided not to close the sky over Ukraine," Zelenskyy said. With this decision, the alliance has given Russia "the green light to the bombing of Ukrainian cities and villages", he added.

158.title: Supreme Court stays Delhi HC order allowing citizens to feed stray dogs
158.article_body: Supreme Court on Friday stayed a Delhi High Court order permitting citizens to feed stray dogs in every residential society. Pointing out its 2015 decision, the SC issued notice on a petition filed by an animal welfare society. The 2015 decision prohibits High Courts from passing orders pertaining to dogs under the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act, 1960.

159.title: Households in Secunderabad Cantonment to get free drinking water
159.article_body: The Hyderabad Metropolitan Water Supply and Sewerage Board (HMWSSB) announced the extension of its free drinking water supply scheme to areas under Secunderabad Cantonment Board. Free drinking water up to 20 kilolitres per month will be provided to every household in the cantonment. The Telangana government has sanctioned a budget of ₹16.8 crore per year on account of the scheme.

160.title: Ukraine spends $15 mn of $50-mn crypto donation on military gear
160.article_body: The Ukrainian government has already spent $15 million of the donations it received in cryptocurrencies on military supplies, including bulletproof vests. The Crypto Fund of Ukraine had raised $50 million in crypto in a week to support Ukraine. The government aims to double the $50 million donated so far in the next two or three days.

161.title: Absorb Ukraine-returned medical students in Indian colleges: TS Singh Deo
161.article_body: Chhattisgarh Health Minister TS Singh Deo has written a letter to Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya expressing concern about the "further education" of the Ukraine-returned medical students. Deo has requested the Centre to absorb them in Indian medical colleges since there is uncertainty about when normalcy will return back to war-hit Ukraine.

162.title: Madurai govt officials to walk, use buses on Wed to curb pollution
162.article_body: According to a circular issued by Tamil Nadu's Madurai District Collector S Aneesh Sekhar, government officials in the district have been told to use buses or walk to offices on Wednesdays every week. It has been done in an effort to control air pollution in the district. This comes following a similar circular issued by Tamil Nadu Pollution Control Board.

163.title: Putin signs law introducing jail for 'fake news' on army; CNN, BBC suspend operations
163.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has signed into law a bill introducing jail terms of up to 15 years for "fake news" about the Russian army. The bill sets out jail terms of varying lengths and fines against people who publish "knowingly false information". Following the news, BBC, Bloomberg and CNN announced that they will temporarily halt operations in the country.

164.title: Shane Warne rightly predicted India-England 2011 World Cup match to be a tie
164.article_body: Before India-England 2011 World Cup match on February 27, 2011, Shane Warne put out a tweet predicting the match would end in a tie. Warne's prediction came true when England scored 338/8 in reply to India's 338, and he was termed a 'genius' by then England captain Andrew Strauss. Warne passed away aged 52 on Friday.

165.title: WB govt fixes cab fare limit, issues new norms for app aggregators
165.article_body: The West Bengal Transport Department issued new norms to regulate mobile application-based cab services to control surcharges on the cab fares. This comes after the state government received several complaints about increased cab fares. The government has fixed per kilometre fare for an AC taxi at ₹18.75 and the base fare of AC taxis has been fixed at ₹36.5.

166.title: Russia blocks Facebook, restricts access to Twitter
166.article_body: Russian media regulator Roskomnadzor has blocked Facebook in the country, claiming it found 26 cases of "discrimination against Russian media" by Facebook since October 2020. "Soon millions of ordinary Russians will find themselves cut off from reliable information...and silenced from speaking out," Meta's Global Affairs President Nick Clegg said. Russia also restricted access to Twitter.

167.title: He gave me my nickname: Ricky Ponting on Shane Warne's demise
167.article_body: Condoling Shane Warne's demise, Ricky Ponting tweeted, "Hard to put this into words. I first met him when I was 15 at...Academy. He gave me my nickname." He added, "We were teammates for [over] a decade...riding all the highs and lows together." Ponting's liking for dog races and betting on them had prompted Warne to give him the nickname 'Punter'.

168.title: I'm grateful to have known him: Hugh Jackman mourns Shane Warne's demise
168.article_body: Actor Hugh Jackman in an Instagram post expressed grief over the demise of former Australian cricketer Shane Warne, who passed away on Friday in Thailand. "I'm in shock to wake to the news that Shane Warne has passed away...I'm grateful to have known him, and to have witnessed his once in a generation talent," Hugh wrote, adding, "Rest well Shane."

169.title: He's stuck in Ukraine: T'gana woman who rode 1,400 km to bring back son during lockdown
169.article_body: The Telangana woman who covered nearly 1,400 km on a scooter over three days to bring home her son after he got stuck in Andhra Pradesh's Nellore due to nationwide lockdown in 2020 has said that he is now stuck in Ukraine. Razia Begum's son Nizamuddin Aman is an MBBS first year student in Ukraine's Sumy.

170.title: India reports 5,921 COVID-19 cases, 289 deaths in last 24 hours
170.article_body: India has reported 5,921 new COVID-19 cases and 289 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 6,396 cases and 201 deaths. India's active caseload stands at 63,878, while the death toll in the country has reached 5,14,878.

171.title: Our first Royal: Rajasthan Royals pen note on Shane Warne after his death
171.article_body: Rajasthan Royals took to Twitter to pen a note on Shane Warne following his demise, writing, "Shane Warne. The name stands for magic. Our first Royal; a man who made us believe that impossible is just a myth." "A mentor who turned everything he touched into gold," Rajasthan Royals added. Rajasthan Royals won IPL 2008 under Warne's captaincy.

172.title: Dismissed policeman destroyed evidence in Antilia bomb scare case: Court
172.article_body: The dismissed Mumbai Police officer Riyazuddin Kazi destroyed evidence in the Antilia bomb scare case, an NIA court said while denying him bail. This was done "with an ulterior motive to screen real offenders", it stated. Kazi had knowledge of the conspiracy hatched for placing explosives near Mukesh Ambani's residence and was following orders of Sachin Waze, the court added.

173.title: Assassinating Putin is not the position of US govt: White House
173.article_body: After US Senator Lindsey Graham called for the assassination of Russian President Vladimir Putin, White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki said, "That's not the position of the US government."
