"We're not advocating for killing the leader of a foreign country or regime change," Psaki added. Graham had called for "somebody in Russia" to assassinate Putin to end the Ukraine war.

174.title: Players shouldn't forget that int'l cricket got them into IPL: Elgar
174.article_body: South Africa Test skipper Dean Elgar said players shouldn't forget that performances for the national team resulted in them earning opportunities to play in the IPL, and not the other way around. IPL 2022 starts on March 26 with Kagiso Rabada, Quinton De Kock among the players set to feature. IPL 2022 will overlap with Bangladesh's tour of South Africa.

175.title: The world is a hard place for Vihari in many ways: Dinesh Karthik
175.article_body: Talking about Hanuma Vihari, Dinesh Karthik said the world is in "many ways" a "hard place" right now for Vihari, as he is batting at the number three position and knows he has limited time. "He is playing one format," added Karthik. Vihari scored 58 runs in the first innings of Team India's opening Test against Sri Lanka.

176.title: Civil engineer posing as policeman sexually harasses 13-yr-old Pune girl
176.article_body: Police have arrested a civil engineering graduate for sexually harassing a 13-year-old girl in Pune by posing as a police officer. The 22-year-old accused was booked along with two minor boys, both aged 13, who put him in touch with the girl. Police said the man was harassing the girl based on a video he had obtained from the boys.

177.title: Thank you for being so bloody good to me: Shane Watson on Shane Warne
177.article_body: Mourning the demise of Australian spin legend Shane Warne, former all-rounder Shane Watson tweeted, “I am numb!!! My hero, my mentor, my great friend, Shane Warne is no longer with us.” He added, “Warnie, the impact you had on this great game and everyone around it is immeasurable. Thank you for being so bloody good to me.”

178.title: Activision CEO Bobby Kotick to leave Coca-Cola board after 10 yrs
178.article_body: Activision Blizzard CEO Bobby Kotick will be stepping down from Coca-Cola's board after 10 years to focus his full attention on Activision's pending acquisition by Microsoft. Kotick informed Coca-Cola he will not stand for reelection to the board. Microsoft's $68.7-billion acquisition of Activision, which is its biggest deal ever, will create the world's third-largest gaming company by revenue.

179.title: Randeep Hooda discharged from hospital post knee surgery
179.article_body: Actor Randeep Hooda has been discharged from Kokilaben Dhirubhai Ambani Hospital in Mumbai post his knee surgery. In a video, the actor was seen making his way out of the hospital with the help of a walker. Randeep suffered the injury last month while performing one of the scenes on the sets of the upcoming web series 'Inspector Avinash'.

180.title: KTR inaugurates four-lane road under bridge at Tukaram Gate in Secunderabad
180.article_body: Municipal Administration and Urban Development Minister KT Rama Rao inaugurated the road under bridge (RuB) at Tukaram Gate in Secunderabad on Friday. The four-lane road is expected to ease traffic congestion on the Malkajgiri, Marredpally, Tarnaka, Mettuguda and Lalapet-Secunderabad roads. It will also provide relief from the frequent closure of railway line crossing at the Lalaguda Station.

181.title: Trump yet to use Truth Social weeks after its launch: Report
181.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump has not added a single post to his social media platform Truth Social, since he launched it weeks ago, Axios reported. The only post on Trump's account is from its beta trial earlier, saying, "Get Ready! Your favourite President will see you soon!" Trump had announced he was creating his own social-media app last year.

182.title: Massive fire breaks out at hospital in Srinagar, patients rescued
182.article_body: A massive fire broke out in Bone and Joint Hospital in Barzulla area of Srinagar district on Friday. According to reports, the fire started at around 9:30 pm, following which several fire tenders rushed to the spot. "There is no loss of life. All patients have been evacuated safely," said Aijaz Asad, Deputy Commissioner, Srinagar.

183.title: Woman attempts self-immolation at Ludhiana police station over police inaction
183.article_body: A woman tried to immolate herself at Division 3 police station in Ludhiana over alleged police inaction on Thursday. She claimed she had been visiting the police station to file an FIR against her two sons and their wives for beating her and her husband up in public but no action was taken. Police, later, filed complaint against the accused.

184.title: Man brandishes sword in public, attacks & threatens police in Pune
184.article_body: A 34-year-old man has been arrested after he allegedly brandished a sword near a public toilet and then attacked and threatened police officers when they tried to stop him in Pune's Warje. The accused has a history of seven-eight cases against him including body offences, robbery and house theft, a police sub-inspector said. The incident took place on Thursday.

185.title: 2 brothers stabbed in Delhi's Mangolpuri over argument, 4 held
185.article_body: Delhi Police apprehended four people, including a juvenile, for allegedly stabbing two brothers following an argument in the Mangolpuri area. A heated argument broke out between the two sides when the victims were going home after closing their shop, and the accused attacked them with a knife and screwdriver, police said. An attempt to murder case has been lodged.

186.title: Polling underway for 22 seats in 2nd phase of Manipur Assembly elections
186.article_body: Voting for the second and last phase of Manipur Assembly elections began at 7 am on Saturday. Altogether 92 candidates across 22 Assembly constituencies are in the fray. A total of 8.38 lakh voters are eligible to cast their votes. Voting will take place till 4 pm. The last one hour will be reserved for COVID-19 patients.

187.title: Could end in full-fledged war: NATO rejects Ukraine's no-fly zone pleas
187.article_body: NATO on Friday rejected pleas from Ukraine to impose a no-fly zone to halt Russia's bombing. "The only way to implement a no-fly zone is to send NATO fighter planes into Ukraine's airspace, and then impose that no-fly zone by shooting down Russian planes...If we did that...[it] could end in a full-fledged war in Europe," NATO chief Jens Stoltenberg said.

188.title: K'taka Budget allocates ₹8,409 cr for development works in B'luru
188.article_body: Karnataka government has allocated ₹8,409 crore for development works in Bengaluru in its Budget for 2022-23 ahead of the city's civic body's polls. This allocation is higher than the previous fiscal year, which was ₹7,795 crore. Of the total allocation, ₹6,000 crore has been set aside for providing basic infrastructure to the city over three years under 'Amruth Nagaroththana' scheme.

189.title: Samsung stops shipping products to Russia, will donate $6 million to Ukraine
189.article_body: Samsung Electronics has suspended shipments of its products to Russia "due to the current geopolitical developments". The South Korean tech giant had the largest share of 30% in Russia's smartphone market in the fourth quarter of 2021, Reuters reported. Samsung is also donating $6 million, including $1 million in consumer electronics, to support humanitarian efforts around the Ukraine region.

190.title: Russian forces are now 32 km from Ukraine's 2nd largest nuclear facility: US
190.article_body: US Ambassador to UN Linda Thomas-Greenfield has said, "Russian forces are now 32 km, and closing, from Ukraine's second largest nuclear facility." She said this after Russia attacked Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine. "We narrowly avoided a disaster last night. The international community must be unanimous in demanding Russia's forces stop their dangerous assault," she added.

191.title: Friends performed CPR on Shane Warne for 20 minutes to try to save him: Police
191.article_body: Police on the Thai island of Koh Samui said that Shane Warne was staying with four friends in his villa. The police added that the friends performed CPR on Warne for 20 minutes to try to revive him. The police further said that there was no sign of intrusion or possessions being searched through at his room.

192.title: Fire breaks out at Mumbai's Dreams mall, 2nd such incident in a year
192.article_body: A major fire broke out at Mumbai's Dreams Mall located in Bhandup area on Friday. However, no casualties or injuries were reported as the mall was closed during the time of the incident. A similar fire incident occurred here nearly a year ago when the mall was being used as COVID-19 ward during which reportedly 11 people lost their lives.

193.title: Ed Sheeran mourns Shane Warne's demise, recalls last conversation with him
193.article_body: Mourning Shane Warne's demise, Ed Sheeran wrote on Instagram, "Shane was the kindest heart, and always went above and beyond to make people feel welcome and special." Recalling his last conversation with Warne, Sheeran wrote, "I spoke to Shane on the anniversary of [Michael Gudinski's] passing this week…saying we were both raising a glass of 707 in his honour."

194.title: He loved you Jaddu: Harsha Bhogle to Jadeja after Warne's demise
194.article_body: Reacting to Ravindra Jadeja's condolence message for Shane Warne on Twitter, commentator Harsha Bhogle wrote, "He loved you Jaddu." Bhogle added, "Remember the time in '08 at DY Patil Stadium...He called you over and said to me 'This kid is a rockstar'." "Yes Harsha bhai, I still remember that chat. Really sad news," Jadeja responded.

195.title: World must not watch, but help: Ukraine amid war
195.article_body: Amid the war in Ukraine, the country's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy tweeted, "The world must not watch, but help." "Nuclear terrorism requires decisive action in response. At the #UN Security Council meeting, we called for closing the sky over Ukraine," he added. Zelenskyy's tweet came after attack on Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine.

196.title: Warne shared pic from his villa hours before his death, wrote 'Goodnight from Koh Samui'
196.article_body: Hours before his death, Australian spin legend Shane Warne had shared a picture from his villa in Thailand on Instagram Stories and wished his followers a good night. He had written, “Goodnight from Koh Samui.” Warne passed away aged 52 due to a suspected heart attack. A week ago, he had expressed his desire to become England head coach.

197.title: Businessman robbed by 5, including police constable in Delhi
197.article_body: A businessman was allegedly robbed by five persons, including a police constable, in Delhi. The constable, who was earlier involved in a gang-rape and attempt to murder cases, is absconding, police said. "The incident took place on February 28 when (businessman) came out from his hotel...was held hostage by two men," police added. The other four accused have been arrested.

198.title: 20-yr-old newly married woman raped by brother-in-law in Greater Noida
198.article_body: A 20-year-old newly married woman was allegedly raped by her brother-in-law in Greater Noida, police said. The woman alleged that her mother-in-law was on the terrace when her brother-in-law overpowered her soon after her husband left home for work on Thursday. Meanwhile, police have launched an investigation into the matter and trying to find the suspect, who's on the run.

199.title: Skywalk linking New Delhi Railway Station & metro station opens for public
199.article_body: DMRC has announced that the 242-metre skywalk between New Delhi Railway Station and its adjacent metro station has been opened for public use from today. DMRC said the skywalk connects the Ajmeri Gate side of the railway station with New Delhi Metro Station on Yellow Line and Airport Express Line. The skywalk also connects with multilevel parking across Bhavbhuti Marg.

200.title: Want to name baby after Operation Ganga: Indian man as pregnant wife rescued from Ukraine
200.article_body: A man from Kerala named Abhijit, along with his 9-month pregnant wife, was trapped in Kyiv in the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war when he managed to move to safety with the help of the Indian embassy staff under Operation Ganga. He later reached Poland safely. "I've decided to name my...baby...Ganga after the name of...rescue operation that India launched," he stated.

201.title: Apple's corporate staff to start returning to offices from April 11
201.article_body: Apple's corporate employees will start returning to offices from April 11, the company's CEO Tim Cook told employees in an email. Employees will be required to work from office at least one day per week by that date, Cook said. He added that employees will need to be in the office at least three days a week from May 23.

202.title: Chhattisgarh journalist arrested over satirical articles on Cong MLAs
202.article_body: A journalist, Nilesh Sharma, was arrested by the cyber cell of Raipur Police for allegedly writing satirical articles with fictional characters resembling ministers and MLAs of ruling Congress. "We have registered the FIR as Sharma was writing baseless articles spreading misinformation and rumours," a police officer said. The complainant is reportedly close to Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel.

203.title: Ukraine still has majority of its air combat power: US official
203.article_body: A US defence official on Friday said, "The Ukrainians still have a significant majority of their air combat power available to them, both fixed-wing and rotary-wing as well as unmanned systems and surface-to-air systems." The Ukrainian military has suffered some losses, including aircraft destroyed by Russian forces, the official added. However, the official did not give any details.

204.title: Immediately cease all hostilities: German Chancellor Scholz to Putin
204.article_body: German government spokesman Steffen Hebestreit said Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Friday urged Russian President Vladimir Putin in an hour-long call to "immediately cease all hostilities and to allow humanitarian access to the embattled areas". French officials said President Emmanuel Macron spoke with Putin a day earlier. Hebestreit added that Scholz and Putin agreed to hold further talks soon.

205.title: Akshay Kumar, Ajay Devgn condole Shane Warne's demise
205.article_body: Bollywood actors took to social media to express condolences on the demise of legendary cricketer Shane Warne. "You could not have loved the game of cricket without being in complete awe of the man. This is so heartbreaking," wrote Akshay Kumar. "Still trying to grapple with the news of Shane Warne's sudden demise. RIP Shane," said Ajay Devgn.

206.title: Left millions in shock, disbelief: Anil Kapoor on Warne's demise
206.article_body: Celebrities and film actors mourned the demise of former cricketer Shane Warne and posted their condolence messages on social media. "This news has left millions like me in shock and disbelief...gone too soon...May you rest in peace king of spin," wrote Anil Kapoor. "Absolutely stunned! You take a piece of every 90s kid with you," said Vikrant Massey.

207.title: Mexican President says his country will not send arms to Ukraine
207.article_body: Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador on Friday said the country will not send arms to Ukraine. "We don't send guns anywhere. We are pacifists," Obrador said. Ukrainian representatives on Thursday sent a letter to the Mexican Senate saying that "only the military and massive support of our allies can help us push back the enemy."

208.title: NIA chargesheets 5 for smuggling arms, narcotics via drones
208.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Friday filed a charge sheet against five persons who "smuggled illegal consignments of arms, ammunition, explosives and narcotics" across the border via drones. According to NIA, these illegal consignments were sent by absconding accused Lakhbir Singh Rode. "Incriminating evidence has been found against all the charge-sheeted accused," the agency added.

209.title: Putin denies bombing Ukrainian cities, says 'air strikes reports are fake'
209.article_body: In a phone call with German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Friday, Russian President Vladimir Putin denied that Russian troops were bombing Ukrainian cities. According to Kremlin, Putin said reports about "the alleged ongoing air strikes of Kyiv and other large cities are gross propaganda fakes". He added that dialogue on Ukraine would be possible only if Russian demands are met.

210.title: In numbers: Australian spin legend Shane Warne's career
210.article_body: Ex-Australia leg-spinner Shane Warne made his international debut in 1992 and retired in 2007. He took 1,001 wickets in 339 international matches. He was the first bowler to reach 600 and 700 Test wickets. Warne took 96 Test wickets in 2005, most by a bowler in a calendar year. He holds the record for taking most wickets in Ashes (195).

211.title: Death toll from blast at mosque in Pak's Peshawar rises to 56
211.article_body: The death toll from the suicide bomb blast at a mosque in Pakistan's Peshawar on Friday rose to 56, according to police and hospital officials. At least 194 people were injured, many of whom were in critical condition. The suicide bomber had strapped a powerful explosive device to his body, packed with five kilograms of explosives, a police official said.

212.title: Entries funded by Russian government barred at Emmys 2022
212.article_body: The National Academy of Television Arts and Sciences (NATAS) has decided to disqualify entries funded by the Russian government for Emmys 2022 amid the Russia-Ukraine conflict. "NATAS has been appalled by Russia's...unprovoked attack on the sovereign territory of Ukraine," a statement by the NATAS chairman said. "Our members feel...deep kinship...for all the Ukrainian people," it added.

213.title: Railways shares video of 2 trains on same track avoiding collision with 'Kavach'
213.article_body: The Ministry of Railways on Friday shared a video of a successful test of the indigenously developed anti-collision system, 'Kavach'. The clip featuring Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw showed two trains approaching each other on the same track and automatically coming to a halt to avoid a collision. 'Kavach' is being promoted as the world's cheapest automatic train collision protection system.

214.title: This is the definition of wrong: Tim Allen on Russia-Ukraine conflict
214.article_body: American actor and comedian Tim Allen has said the ongoing Russian military operation in Ukraine is the "definition of wrong". "My mind and body are full of anger and disgust at the coward Putin ghouls that have attacked a sovereign country," Tim wrote on Twitter. "My head, heart and soul pray for the people of Ukraine," he added.

215.title: I want a family with you: Britney in birthday note for fiancé
215.article_body: Pop singer Britney Spears on Friday penned a note for her fiancé Sam Asghari on his birthday. "I love you so much...I want a family with you...I want it all with you," she wrote in an Instagram post. Sam commented on Britney's post and wrote, "Millions of things to wish for. I only have one wish."

216.title: Russia's neighbours should not escalate tensions: President Putin
216.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday urged Russia's neighbours to not escalate tensions amid Russia-Ukraine war. "There are no bad intentions towards our neighbours," said Putin. Putin also advised the neighbouring countries to not introduce restrictions against Russia. This comes eight days after Putin launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine killing 331 civilians including 19 children.

217.title: Happy with the way Poland helped Indian students: Jamnagar royal
217.article_body: Shatrushalyasinhji Jadeja, the patriarch of the royal family of the former princely state of Nawanagar-Jamnagar, has thanked the Poland government and the country's people for helping in the evacuation of Indian students stuck in war-hit Ukraine. Jadeja's father Maharaja Jamsaheb Digvijaysinhji had hosted nearly 1,000 Polish children, mostly orphans, as they sought to escape World War II.

218.title: My wife has all qualities except loyalty: Sam on Poonam Pandey
218.article_body: After being accused of domestic violence, producer Sam Bombay has said his wife Poonam Pandey "has all the qualities except loyalty". "Assault comes in various forms...Whatever happened between us, I wasn't the one who initiated [it]," Sam added. He said both of them loved each other but won't patch up because they have their own egos.

219.title: PM made Kashmir 'crown of India' after revoking Article 370: Shah
219.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah, while addressing a rally in UP's Ghazipur on Friday, said that PM Narendra Modi made Kashmir the "crown of India" following the revocation of Article 370. Further alleging that Samajwadi Party President Akhilesh Yadav had said there will be a "bloodbath" following the move, Shah claimed, "Nobody even pelted a pebble, let alone a bloodbath".

220.title: It's my resolution that every poor should have their own house: PM
220.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, while addressing an election rally in Uttar Pradesh's Mirzapur on Friday, said that it is his "resolution that every poor should have their own house". He further said, "They (Samajwadi Party) have built only 800 houses for the poor in Mirzapur, but in the last five years our government has built 28,000 houses for people of Mirzapur."

221.title: Ukraine will likely see more deaths, suffering, destruction: NATO
221.article_body: NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg on Friday warned conflict in Ukraine will likely see "more deaths, more suffering and more destruction" as Russian troops attempt to gain control. "We call on President Vladimir Putin to stop this war immediately..." said Stoltenberg. Meanwhile, 331 civilians including 19 children have been killed in Ukraine since Russian invasion on February 24.

222.title: Sanctioned Russian billionaire barred from his European firm's offices
222.article_body: Mikhail Fridman, Russian Co-founder of Luxembourg-based investment group LetterOne, has been barred from entering the company's office buildings or speaking to its employees after the European Union (EU) imposed sanctions on him. LetterOne also said that billionaire Fridman and Russian banker Petr Aven have stepped down from the company's board and their assets in the business have been frozen.

223.title: Sonowal announces ₹100 cr investment for AYUSH sector in Nagaland
223.article_body: An investment of over ₹100 crore will be made towards the development of the AYUSH Healthcare sector in Nagaland, Union Minister Sarbananda Sonowal announced on Friday. The allocated funds are to be used to develop a 30-bedded dedicated hospital and three 10-bedded hospitals. A state-of-the-art ayurvedic college will also be developed at Longleng at an estimated cost of ₹70 crore.

224.title: Aus woman wins ₹56 lakh lottery, days after mistaking official's calls as spam
224.article_body: An Australian woman won a lottery of A$100,000 (around ₹56 lakh), days after she ignored various phone calls assuming they were spam. The woman, who had purchased the lottery ticket on February 25, received phones calls and emails from a lottery official, which she ignored thinking they were a "scam". She found out about the lottery through her lottery account.

225.title: Legends live on: Shilpa as she pays tribute to Shane Warne
225.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty on Friday paid tribute to former Australian cricketer Shane Warne on his demise. "Legends live on," Shilpa wrote in the caption of her Instagram post along with a heart emoticon. Shilpa was a co-owner of IPL team Rajasthan Royals, which won the title in the inaugural year under the captaincy of Shane Warne.

226.title: Entire world passing through a delicate period now: PM Modi
226.article_body: Addressing an election rally in UP's Mirzapur, PM Narendra Modi said, "The entire world now is passing through a 'najuk daur' (delicate period) of this century." "Many countries are today affected by epidemic, disturbance and uncertainty," he added. Irrespective of how deep the crisis is, India's response is even bigger, he further said.

227.title: Ukraine tells people to add news about Ukraine in Google reviews for Russian eateries
227.article_body: Ukraine released a video instructing people, how they can add news about Ukraine in Google reviews for Russian restaurants. "Detailed instructions on how to "reach" the Russians, breaking through the information blockade of the Russian Federation," it tweeted. The video states that after selecting any Russian restaurant on Google Maps, people can post news or pictures of destruction in Ukraine.

228.title: An absolute legend and champion of our game has left us: Rohit on Warne's demise
228.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma mourned the demise of former Australia leg-spinner Shane Warne. "I'm truly lost for words here, this is extremely sad," he wrote on Twitter. "An absolute legend and champion of our game has left us. RIP Shane Warne...still can't believe it," Rohit further said. Warne died due to suspected heart attack.

229.title: Akhilesh cares for one community, one caste: Shah at UP poll rally
229.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday said Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav only cares for "one community and one caste". Addressing an election rally in UP, Shah said Akhilesh only sees people of one community "which we are not part of". "We are building homes for poor on the lands which were once occupied by the mafia," Shah added.

230.title: Life is so fickle and unpredictable, I cannot process it: Kohli on Warne's demise
230.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli took to social media to mourn the demise of former Australia leg-spinner Shane Warne. "Life is so fickle and unpredictable. I cannot process the passing of this great of our sport and also a person I got to know off the field. RIP #goat. Greatest to turn the cricket ball," he wrote.

231.title: I got ₹1,200 a day for first show, lower than junior staff: Ronit
231.article_body: Actor Ronit Roy has said he was offered ₹1,200 per day for his first TV show whereas his driver informed him that junior artistes received ₹1,500. "At that time, I needed to get back to work, I needed to say yes," Ronit said. "I am glad that I did that as it translated into more work," he added.

232.title: Centre constitutes Swadesh Darshan Awards, invites entries
232.article_body: The Union Ministry of Tourism on Thursday constituted Swadesh Darshan Awards in different categories. The ministry has decided to invite entries under categories like Best Tourist Interpretation Centre, Best Log Hut Facility, Best Cafeteria, etc. The awards aim at recognising efforts undertaken in the tourism sector by state governments, Union Territory administrations and implementation agencies.

233.title: Meesho aiming for IPO in 2023, considering India, US listing: Report
233.article_body: Bengaluru-based social commerce platform Meesho is aiming to go public in early 2023 and is evaluating both Indian and US exchanges, reported Reuters. "Meesho...wants to essentially be done with IPO (initial public offering) by the first half of 2023," Reuters quoted a source as saying. Founded by Vidit Aatrey and Sanjeev Barnwal, Meesho counts Meta and SoftBank as its investors.

234.title: Priest arrested after Dalit woman stopped from entering MP temple
234.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Police have arrested a priest for allegedly preventing a 31-year-old Dalit woman from entering a temple on Tuesday. The priest and two other women, who are currently absconding, had allegedly abused the complainant and told her she wasn't allowed as a special Patidar community pooja was going on. A video of the incident went viral on social media.

235.title: AC tram catches fire in Kolkata due to glitches, none injured
235.article_body: An air-conditioned tram with passengers caught fire on Friday while it was moving through Kolkata's Beniapukur area, the police said. No one was injured in the incident. The fire broke around 1 pm due to some technical glitches. "One fire tender was pressed into service, which brought the blaze under control," a police officer said.

236.title: Russia's private airline S7 to suspend all flights abroad from Mar 5
236.article_body: Russia's biggest private airline, S7 on Friday announced suspension of all international flights starting Saturday, March 5. This comes as US, UK and European Union are set to shut their airspace to Russian flights from next week as part of punitive measures after Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24. Meanwhile, another Russian airline, Smartavia suspended all international flights from today.

237.title: Over 90% of US population in areas where masks are not needed: CDC
237.article_body: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) on Thursday said around 93% of the US population live in counties where COVID-19 levels are low enough that wearing masks indoors is no longer required. When the CDC eased its COVID-19 guidelines last week, around 72% of the population lived in areas experiencing low or medium levels of COVID-19.

238.title: Buses being operated from Ukraine to evacuate Indians: Centre
238.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs said on Friday that five buses are being operated to evacuate Indians from Kharkiv and Pisochin in eastern Ukraine. Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said, "900-1000 Indians [are] stranded in Pisochin and over 700 in Sumy." He said the Indian government had requested Ukrainian authorities to arrange special trains but it's yet to get a response.

239.title: KCR meets J'khand CM in Ranchi, says no anti-BJP front formed yet
239.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao met Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren at the latter's residence in Ranchi on Friday. Addressing reporters, KCR said, "We're clear...efforts should be made to take India in a new direction." Further speaking on the formation of an anti-BJP front, he added, "People are talking about a third front, a fourth front...no front has been formed yet."

240.title: ICC team going to Ukraine to probe war crimes: ICC Prosecutor
240.article_body: The International Criminal Court's (ICC) Chief Prosecutor Karim Khan said a team set off for Ukraine on Thursday to investigate potential war crimes committed during Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Khan said they will look for evidence of war crimes, acts of genocide and crimes against humanity by all parties involved. The ICC has 123 member states.

241.title: You always had a special place for India: Sachin Tendulkar after Shane Warne's demise
241.article_body: Following the demise of ex-Australia cricketer Shane Warne, Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "Shocked, stunned & miserable...Will miss you Warnie. There was never a dull moment with you around...on or off the field." He added, "Will always treasure our on field duels & off field banter. You always had a special place for India & Indians had a special place for you."

242.title: What is Kavach, Made-in-India system to prevent collision of trains?
242.article_body: Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Friday reviewed 'Kavach', an indigenously developed anti-collision system. Being promoted as the world's cheapest automatic train collision protection system, it is a set of electronic devices installed in locomotives as well as the tracks to bring a train to a halt automatically if it notices another train on the same track within a prescribed distance.

243.title: Magician with the ball: Irfan Pathan on Shane Warne’s demise
243.article_body: Former Indian cricketer Irfan Pathan on Friday condoled the demise of former Australian leg-spinner Shane Warne on Twitter, saying, "Shane Warne was a crowd puller. Magician with the ball. Absolute legend of Australian cricket. First IPL winning captain. He will be missed, He will be remembered forever." Warne died aged 52 of a suspected heart attack.

244.title: Balakrishnan re-elected as Kerala CPI(M) state secy for 3rd time
244.article_body: CPI(M) leader Kodiyeri Balakrishnan was on Friday re-elected as the party's state secretary in Kerala for the third consecutive time. He told reporters that CM Pinarayi Vijayan had suggested his name for the post, adding, "The party's state committee has expressed confidence in me for...third time". The state conference also elected an 88-member state committee and a 17-member state secretariat.

245.title: K'taka HC quashes FIR against Dream11 Co-founders over online gambling law
245.article_body: The Karnataka High Court has quashed an FIR filed by the state police against Dream11 Co-founders Harsh Jain and Bhavit Sheth for allegedly violating Karnataka's ban on online gambling last year. The development comes after the court struck down provisions of the Karnataka Police (Amendment) Act, 2021, which prohibited and criminalised online gambling and betting, calling them unconstitutional.

246.title: 331 civilians including 19 children killed, 675 hurt in Ukraine: UN
246.article_body: Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR) on Friday said 331 civilians including 19 children were killed in Ukraine since Russia invaded on February 24. The office added 675 others were injured so far. As per OHCHR, most of the civilians were killed by heavy artillery shelling, multi-launch rocket systems, missiles and air strikes.

247.title: Italian PM condemns Russian attack on Ukrainian nuclear plant
247.article_body: Italian Prime Minister Mario Draghi on Friday condemned Russia's attack on the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant in Ukraine, calling the incident an "attack on everyone's security". Draghi's office added in a statement, "The European Union must continue to react united and with the utmost firmness, together with its allies, to support Ukraine and protect European citizens."

248.title: Rajasthan govt to hold 'Braj Holi Mahotsav' from March 12 to 14
248.article_body: A three-day festival 'Braj Holi Mahotsav' will be organised in Bharatpur, Deeg and Kaman cities of Rajasthan from March 12 to 14. "The east of Rajasthan is imbued with the essence of Braj and the...festival...is a celebration of the rich traditions,” said Nishant Jain, Director, Department of Tourism, Rajasthan. "It is set to enthral visitors of all ages," he added.

249.title: Paralysed man kidnapped in MP's Jabalpur, ₹15 lakh ransom sought
249.article_body: A 25-year-old man suffering from paralysis has been kidnapped by unidentified men in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur district, the police said on Friday. The victim has been identified as Rahul Singh. An unidentified caller demanded ₹15 lakh from Rahul's family for his release, said Inspector NR Sinha. Rahul had gone to a local market on Wednesday but did not return home.

250.title: In pics: Late Australian cricketer Shane Warne
250.article_body: A photo gallery shows moments from late Australian cricketer Shane Warne's life. Regarded as 'King of Spin', his international career spanned 15 years and saw him take 708 Test wickets and a total of 1,001 international wickets. Warne passed away at the age of 52 due to suspected heart attack in Thailand.

251.title: World no. 1 Ashleigh Barty withdraws from Indian Wells, Miami events
251.article_body: World number one Ashleigh Barty on Thursday said she will miss the upcoming WTA 1000 events in Indian Wells and Miami due to fitness issues. "I don't believe I am at the level necessary to win these events and as a result I have decided to withdraw from both tournaments," she said. Barty, 25, won the Australian Open in January.

252.title: India's new envoy Pradeep Kumar Rawat arrives in China
252.article_body: India's new Ambassador to China Pradeep Kumar Rawat has arrived in the country and is currently undergoing mandatory quarantine, the Indian Embassy in Beijing said on Friday. Rawat succeeds Ambassador Vikram Misri, who was appointed as Deputy National Security Advisor. Rawat's previous tenure in Beijing began in 2003 as Counsellor and ended in 2007 as Deputy Chief of Mission.

253.title: Russian athletes to leave Beijing, will not appeal Paralympics ban
253.article_body: The Russian Paralympic Committee (RPC) on Friday said its contingent in Beijing will leave China after being banned from competing following Russia's invasion of Ukraine, adding it will not appeal the decision. The International Paralympic Committee (IPC) on Thursday banned Russian and Belarusian athletes from participating in the Games after initially allowing them to compete as neutral athletes.

254.title: BJP will always keeps its promises no matter what the cost: Rajnath
254.article_body: Speaking at an election rally in Jaunpur, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Friday said that the BJP never breaks the trust of people and fulfils promises it makes no matter what the cost. Notably, he also said that individuals from BJP may be unable to fulfil their promises. Singh claimed BJP will win around 300 seats in UP Assembly polls.

255.title: Cheating case accused escapes from police custody in Chandigarh
255.article_body: An accused in a cheating case escaped from police custody at the Sector 8 market in Chandigarh on Thursday. The man has been identified as Himanshu Kakkria. The police later recovered a pistol from his Toyota Fortuner parked in the market. "He managed to flee with his wife and their acquaintance," said Naveen Pal, Station House Officer, Mattaur, Mohali.

256.title: Shane Warne produced 'ball of the century' with his 1st ever Ashes delivery
256.article_body: Legendary Australian spinner Shane Warne, who passed away aged 52 of a suspected heart attack in Thailand, bowled a big leg-break as his first delivery in Ashes to clean bowl Mike Gatting on June 4, 1993. The flighted delivery drifted in, then dipped and eventually hit Gatting's off-stump with sharp turn and is popularly known as "ball of the century".

257.title: Former world no. 1 Murray to renew Ivan Lendl as coach for a 3rd stint
257.article_body: Former world number one Andy Murray is set to renew his relationship with eight-time Grand Slam winner Ivan Lendl as his coach for a third stint together. They first worked together from 2011 to 2014, then from 2016 to 2017. Their partnership between 2012 and 2016 led to Murray winning three Grand Slam titles and two consecutive Olympic gold medals.

258.title: Murray receives wild card into ATP Masters 1000 event in Indian Wells
258.article_body: Former world number one Andy Murray has been given a wild card entry into the upcoming ATP Masters 1000 event, the BNP Paribas Open in Indian Wells. Murray previously reached the final of the tournament in 2009, where he lost to Rafael Nadal. Murray was beaten by Alexander Zverev 6-4, 7-6(4) in the third round of the tournament last year.

259.title: Russian lawmakers pass bill imposing jail for fake news about army
259.article_body: Russian lawmakers on Friday passed a bill imposing jail term of up to 15 years for intentionally spreading fake news about country's armed forces. This comes as Russian officials have repeatedly accused US and European allies of spreading false information against Russia. The law will be enforced only after the bill is signed by President Vladimir Putin.

260.title: Ukraine, Japan discuss Russian attack at Ukrainian nuclear plant site
260.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Friday informed Japanese PM Fumio Kishida about Russia's "nuclear terrorism" at Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant. "We both agree on the gravity of threats to global security," Zelenskyy said. He also shared details of blaze at the nuclear plant site with Kishida. Earlier, a fire broke out at Europe's biggest nuclear plant due to Russian shelling.

261.title: He was always magical on the field: Raina on Shane Warne’s death
261.article_body: Former Indian cricketer Suresh Raina condoled the death of former Australian spinner Shane Warne on Twitter, saying, "At loss of words to hear the demise of our cricketing legend Shane Warne, he was always magical on the field. May peace be with you. My heartfelt condolences to his family and loved ones." Warne died of a suspected heart attack.

262.title: RIP my hero, totally shattered: Harbhajan on Shane Warne's death
262.article_body: Former India cricketer Harbhajan Singh on Friday condoled the demise of Shane Warne, who passed away due to a suspected heart attack. "Nooooooooooooooo can't believe you are no more Shane Warne," tweeted Harbhajan. "RIP my HERO...don't wanna believe this...totally shattered," he added. Warne died at the age of 52.

263.title: Microsoft suspends sales of products & services in Russia
263.article_body:
Microsoft on Friday announced that it was suspending new sales of its products and services in Russia amid its ongoing invasion of Ukraine. Microsoft added that it will proactively work to help 
cybersecurity officials in Ukraine defend against Russian attacks. "We stand with Ukraine in calling for the restoration of peace, respect for Ukraine’s sovereignty," the company added.

264.title: Nation will remain indebted to him: PM on demise of ex-Army chief
264.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday condoled the demise of former Army chief SF Rodrigues and tweeted that the "nation will remain indebted to him for his exceptional service and contribution towards making India stronger". He added, "He was respected for his deep strategic knowledge. My thoughts are with his family and friends." Rodrigues passed away at the age of 88.

265.title: SP only party to raise issue of unemployment in UP: Mulayam
265.article_body: Samajwadi Party patriarch Mulayam Singh Yadav on Friday claimed that it was only the SP party that raised the issue of unemployment in Uttar Pradesh, adding that the party would provide employment opportunities to youth if it forms the government in the state. He said, "The party has always worked for poor, youth, uneducated and the ignored sections of society."

266.title: 'Goal by July is to get back in shape': Shane Warne in his last Instagram post
266.article_body: Ex-Australia leg-spinner Shane Warne, who passed away in Thailand, had shared a post on Instagram four days ago revealing his plan to get in shape by July. Sharing a throwback picture, he had written, "Operation shred has started (10 days in) and...goal by July is to get back to this shape from a few years ago! Let’s go."

267.title: No words to describe how shocked I am: Shoaib Akhtar on Shane Warne's death
267.article_body: Former Pakistani cricketer Shoaib Akhtar took to Twitter to condole the death of former Australian cricketer Shane Warne, who died on Friday in Thailand. Sharing his picture, Akhtar wrote, "Just heard the devastating news about legendary Shane Warne passing away. No words to describe how shocked & sad I am. What a legend. What a man. What a cricketer."

268.title: Ex-Army Chief General Sunith Francis Rodrigues passes away at 88
268.article_body: General (retd) Sunith Francis Rodrigues, who headed the Indian Army between 1990 and 1993, passed away at the age of 88 on Friday. "Known as a Thinker and Strategist, he leaves behind a legacy of utmost dedication and service to the Nation," an official statement said. Rodrigues had also served as the Governor of Punjab between 2004 and 2010.

269.title: The man who made spin cool is no more: Sehwag on Shane Warne's demise
269.article_body: Former Indian cricketer Virender Sehwag condoled the death of former Australia leg-spinner Shane Warne, saying, "Cannot believe it. One of the greatest spinners, the man who made spin cool, superstar Shane Warne is no more." He added, "Life is very fragile, but this is very difficult to fathom. My heartfelt condolences to his family, friends and fans around the world."

270.title: Shane Warne condoled ex-Aus keeper Rod Marsh's demise in last tweet hours before death
270.article_body: Former Australian cricketer Shane Warne had condoled the demise of former Australian keeper Rod Marsh in his last tweet hours before his death. "Rod cared deeply about cricket & gave so much-especially to Australia & England players. Sending lots & lots of love to Ros & the family. RIP mate," he wrote. Warne passed away aged 52.

271.title: Israel can be potential ally if Palestinian conflict resolved: Saudi
271.article_body: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed Bin Salman has said, "We look at Israel as a potential ally but before that it should solve its problems with the Palestinians." Separately, he also said that Saudi Arabia intends to continue "detailed talks" with Iran in order to reach a satisfactory agreement for both. Saudi Arabia doesn't have diplomatic ties with Israel and Iran.

272.title: What weapons are being used by Russia in war with Ukraine?
272.article_body: Russian military has used warplanes, tanks, howitzers, Kalibr cruise missiles and Iskander missiles, which have a range of up to 500km, in Ukraine, according to AP. Ukrainian officials have accused Russia of using cluster bombs, rockets and artillery shells, which release "bomblets" that hit multiple targets. Ukraine also accused Russia of using thermobaric bombs that can vaporise targets.

273.title: Former Australia cricketer Shane Warne passes away aged 52 due to suspected heart attack
273.article_body: Former Australia leg-spinner Shane Warne has passed away at the age of 52. Warne's management released a statement, saying that he passed away in Thailand due to a suspected heart attack. “Warne was found unresponsive in his villa and despite the best efforts of medical staff, he could not be revived,” the statement read.

274.title: Video shows PM playing 'damru' at Kashi Vishwanath Temple in UP
274.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday was seen playing a 'damru' at the Kashi Vishwanath Temple in his Lok Sabha constituency Varanasi, a video of which has surfaced. He also offered prayers at the temple. Earlier in the day, PM Modi held a roadshow in Varanasi ahead of the last phase of Assembly polls in Uttar Pradesh on March 7.

275.title: Couple gets married in Ukraine's bomb shelter amid Russian invasion
275.article_body: A couple in Ukraine tied the knot in a bomb shelter amid the Russian invasion of the country. A video of their ceremony showed the bride holding a bouquet of flowers while a guest held a traditional Ukrainian wedding bread. The couple also signed marriage documents while a group of people cheered around them.

276.title: Morphed pic claiming Salman married Sonakshi goes viral, actress says 'Are you so dumb?'
276.article_body: A morphed picture claiming to show actors Salman Khan and Sonakshi Sinha secretly getting married went viral recently. The actress, while reacting to it, called out people believing the picture to be genuine. "Are you so dumb that you can't tell the difference between a real and a morphed picture?????" she commented on an Instagram post along with laughing emojis.

277.title: Hyd Police to conduct 'Gender Equality run' to mark Women's Day
277.article_body: Hyderabad Police's She Team will be conducting a 'Gender Equality 2K & 5K Run' to celebrate International Women's Day. The event will be held at People's Plaza, Necklace Road in Hyderabad on Sunday from 5.30 am. Those who sign up for the event will be entitled to a t-shirt, finisher medal and post-run breakfast as part of the registration fee.

278.title: Shahid Kapoor buys newly launched Mercedes-Maybach S-Class worth ₹2.5 crore, pics surface
278.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor has purchased the newly-launched Mercedes-Maybach S 580, pictures of which have surfaced online. He bought the car for ₹2.5 crore, said reports. Pictures of Shahid and his wife Mira Kapoor along with the car had surfaced on social media. Shahid reportedly purchased the new car as a 41st birthday present for himself.

279.title: Reassuring to see over 20,000 Indians have left Ukraine: Govt
279.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) on Friday informed that over 20,000 Indians have left war-hit Ukraine since advisories were issued. "There are more people, but it's reassuring to see that these many people have left Ukraine," spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said. India launched Operation Ganga to bring back citizens stuck in Ukraine after Russia invaded its neighbour last week.

280.title: Govt defers DefExpo 2022 to be held in Guj over logistics problems
280.article_body: The Ministry of Defence said on Friday that the DefExpo 2022 which was scheduled to be held in Gujarat's Gandhinagar from March 10-14 has been postponed due to "logistics problems being experienced by participants". PM Narendra Modi was to inaugurate the event. Earlier, the ministry said that 973 exhibitors, including 121 foreign exhibitors from 63 countries, had registered.

281.title: Nawazuddin spoke of his struggling days, I felt I'm on right path: Surya
281.article_body: Actor Surya Sharma has said that when actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui told him about his struggling days, he realised that he is on the right path in his career. The actor added that he met Nawazuddin at an acting workshop during his own struggling days. Surya further said that he has learnt a lot from Nawazuddin.

282.title: In next 5yrs, India will be world's biggest film industry: Prabhas
282.article_body: Actor Prabhas has said that pan-India films have opened many doors, adding that in the next five years, India will be the biggest film industry in the world. "Hollywood has one language in which films are made and so is the case with Chinese or Korean films. But in India, we have films being made in several languages," Prabhas added.

283.title: Pak Prez Arif Alvi appears before court in 2014 PTV attack case
283.article_body: Pakistan President Arif Alvi on Friday appeared before an anti-terrorism court in the 2014 Pakistan Television Corporation and Parliament House attack case. Members of ruling Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf party were involved in the attack. Alvi, who filed an application to decline availing Presidential immunity, said, "I appeared before the court today as a common citizen and not as the President."

284.title: Will pay for his treatment in Ukraine: Govt on Harjot who was shot at in Kyiv
284.article_body: The government of India will be bearing expenses for Harjot Singh's medical treatment in Ukraine, the Ministry of External Affairs said on Friday. "We're trying to ascertain his medical status...Our embassy is...trying to reach out but facing trouble as it's a conflict zone," said MEA spokesperson. Singh was shot at in Kyiv on February 27.

285.title: Meghan sued by half-sister over alleged false, malicious statements
285.article_body: Meghan Markle is being sued by her half-sister Samantha over her interview with Oprah Winfrey for allegedly making "false and malicious statements". Samantha stated that Meghan falsely claimed she raised herself from poverty and worked low-paying jobs to make ends meet. The lawsuit further stated that Meghan misled the public about her father's absence from her wedding with Prince Harry.

286.title: Let us evacuate our people, urge you to have local ceasefire: India to Russia & Ukraine
286.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs on Friday urged Russia and Ukraine "to have a local ceasefire at least so that we can evacuate our people, students". MEA Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said that evacuation looks difficult without a ceasefire. This comes as government launched 'Operation Ganga' to evacuate all Indian nationals from Ukraine amid war.

287.title: Fan holds AP Dhillon song-inspired poster for Virat Kohli, pic goes viral
287.article_body: A picture of a fan holding a poster, inspired by AP Dhillon's song 'Excuses', in the stands during the first day of India-Sri Lanka Test in Mohali went viral. The poster dedicated to Virat Kohli read, "Kehndi hundi si 100 banade (She used to say 'Score a hundred')." Kohli got out for 45 runs off 76 deliveries in first innings.

288.title: Researchers discover world's oldest-ever stegosaurus fossil in China
288.article_body: Researchers from China, UK discovered world's oldest-ever stegosaurus fossil in China. Named Bashanosaurus primitivus, it lived 168 million years ago suggesting stegosaurus might have originated in Asia. With a length of 2.8 metres, Bashanosaurus had armour plates which were thicker, narrower than other stegosaurs but similar to those of first armoured dinosaurs that are over 20 million years old.

289.title: Man arrested for committing burglaries, possessing drugs in Hyd
289.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Friday arrested a man on charges of illegal possession of narcotic substances and committing burglaries. They have seized 1.2 kg marijuana, 10 ml of hashish oil, cash and other valuables worth a total of ₹3 lakh from him. The accused, Ahmed Pasha, was earlier involved in 19 burglary cases in Hyderabad, Cyberabad and Rachakonda, the DCP said.

290.title: Global food practices cause 21-37% greenhouse gas emissions: Report
290.article_body: Centre for Science and Environment's annual report stated that global food practices of 7.8 billion people account for 21-37% greenhouse gas emissions every year. The report further noted emissions from food system alone will cause earth to heat above the target of 1.5 degree Celsius. The report was released by Bhupender Yadav, Minister for Environment, Forest & Climate Change.

291.title: Sending charter plane after death doesn't matter: Indian shot at in Ukraine
291.article_body: Indian national Harjot Singh who was shot at in war-hit Ukraine has sought evacuation to India, saying, "It doesn't matter if you send a charter (plane) after death." He added, "God has given me a second life, I want to live it." Singh, who is from Delhi, said he hasn't received any support from the Indian embassy in Ukraine yet.

292.title: Our forces won't participate in Russia-Ukraine war: Belarus Prez
292.article_body: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko on Friday said Belarusian armed forces were not taking part and would not take part in Russia's military operation in Ukraine. He added he had a long and detailed telephonic conversation with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday. This comes as a senior Belarusian military official said it has strengthened its air defences along the border.

293.title: UN human rights body sets up panel to monitor human rights in Ukraine
293.article_body: UN Human Rights Council on Friday set up a three-member panel to monitor human rights in Ukraine amid war with Russia. The council voted 32-2 to pass a resolution that was presented by many Western countries with 13 member states including China abstained from voting. Meanwhile, as per UN, over 1 million refugees fled Ukraine in just seven days.

294.title: Netflix pauses future Russian projects amid conflict with Ukraine
294.article_body: Streaming service Netflix has paused all future projects and acquisitions with Russia due to its military operations in Ukraine. Netflix had four Russian original projects in the pipeline including a crime thriller series which was shooting and has been postponed. Earlier Disney and Warner Bros announced that they will be pausing all theatrical releases in Russia.

295.title: 'Namma Clinics' to be set up in all wards of Bengaluru: CM Bommai
295.article_body: Presenting the 2022-23 state Budget, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai announced that 'Namma Clinics' will be established in Bengaluru. Bommai said the clinics, which are reportedly similar to Delhi's Mohalla Clinics, will be established in all wards of Bengaluru. The services of detection of non-communicable diseases and referral for higher treatment to specialists will be provided in these clinics.

296.title: Google Maps, Tripadvisor disable adding new reviews for Russian businesses
296.article_body: Google has blocked users from adding reviews on Maps for places in Russia, Ukraine and Belarus. Tripadvisor has also blocked reviews for restaurants and hotels where people had started posting comments on the Russia-Ukraine conflict as reviews. Hacking group Anonymous had earlier asked users to leave messages about the situation in Ukraine in Google Maps reviews for Russian businesses.

297.title: K'taka CM allocates ₹1,000 crore to implement Mekedatu project
297.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai, while presenting the state Budget for 2022-23 today, announced that ₹1,000 crore has been allocated for the implementation of the Mekedatu project. He said the Mekedatu Balancing Reservoir and Bengaluru Drinking Water Project will be implemented by getting a nod from the centre. This comes after the Congress concluded its Mekedatu padayatra on Thursday in Bengaluru.

298.title: Meghalaya becomes 9th state to withdraw general consent to CBI
298.article_body: Meghalaya has become the ninth Indian state to withdraw general consent given to CBI. Notably, BJP is a partner in the ruling coalition, led by CM Conrad Sangma. Terming it a normal procedure, Sangma said, "Anybody who comes in here, has to take consent." Mizoram was the first state to withdraw consent in 2015 when it was ruled by Congress.

299.title: I'm not getting into movies: Aamir Khan's daughter Ira Khan
299.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan's daughter Ira on Thursday took to Instagram Stories to hold an 'ask me anything' session. She later shared a story of her answers, one of which stated, "I'm not getting into movies." Ira has made her directorial debut in theatre. She helmed a play called 'Medea' in which the lead role was played by actress Hazel Keech.

300.title: Ex-German Chancellor Schroeder should resign from Russian firms: Scholz
300.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz has called on former Chancellor Gerhard Schroeder to resign from his posts at Russian firms. Schroeder is said to be a long-time friend of Russian President Vladimir Putin and is currently the chairman of the supervisory board of the Russian state energy company Rosneft. Scholz added the ex-chancellor's ties with Russian companies were not private matters.

301.title: Ridiculous: Sunny on trolls saying she adopted daughter for publicity
301.article_body: Actress Sunny Leone has called the trolls who accused her of adopting her daughter for publicity ridiculous and childish. "I think that the person who wrote that is someone who is not a part of my daily life," the actress added. Sunny further said that 'grow up' is the thing she will say for the comments that were made.

302.title: African arrested at Mumbai airport for smuggling drugs worth ₹2 cr
302.article_body: A 43-year-old African citizen has been arrested by the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) for allegedly smuggling cocaine worth nearly ₹2.30 crore. Kaba Ibrahimaat was intercepted at the Mumbai airport by DRI officials following a tip-off. No drugs were found in his baggage, however, it later emerged that he had swallowed the contraband in pellet form.

303.title: Atal Bihari Vajpayee park to be built on 350-acre land in B'luru: Bommai
303.article_body: Presenting the 2022-23 state Budget, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai announced to set up an Atal Bihari Vajpayee park on a 350 acre land in the Jarakabande area of Bengaluru's Yelahanka to increase the city's green cover. The proposed park will be based on the model of Bengaluru's Lalbagh and Cubbon Park. Notably, Bommai has allocated ₹8,409 crore for Bengaluru's development.

304.title: Which nations supported Russia or abstained from UNHRC vote on Ukraine crisis?
304.article_body: The UN Human Rights Council has said it has decided to establish an independent commission of inquiry as a result of Russia's aggression against Ukraine after a vote. While Eritrea and Russian Federation voted against the formation of the commission, India, Armenia, Bolivia, Cameroon, China, Cuba, Gabon, Kazakhstan, Namibia, Pakistan, Sudan, Uzbekistan and Venezuela abstained from voting.

305.title: Russian lawmakers introduce jail terms for 'fake' news about military
305.article_body: Russian lawmakers on Friday passed legislation to impose fines and jail terms for spreading "fake" news about Russia's armed forces. The amendments have to be approved by Parliament's upper house before going to President Vladimir Putin to be signed into law. Russia's enemies have spread false information in an attempt to sow discord among Russian people, officials claimed.

306.title: Domestic help in Mumbai clicks indecent pics of minors, held
306.article_body: A 27-year-old domestic help in Mumbai has been arrested for allegedly clicking pictures and videos of his employer's 13-year-old daughter and 11-year-old niece while they were changing clothes or bathing. According to police, the accused was caught after the 13-year-old came across the pictures while playing games on his phone. Police also found pictures of other minors on the device.

307.title: Fire at communications centre disrupts internet in Iran's capital
307.article_body: The Iranian Communications Ministry on Friday said that a fire at the main telecommunications building in Tehran disrupted internet services in Iran's capital and the nearby city of Karaj. The fire was caused by a malfunction in a power connection, it added. Notably, Iran has some of the strictest controls on internet access in the world.

308.title: Kareena, Alia don't shy away from any kind of cinema: Ananya
308.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday has said that Kareena Kapoor and Alia Bhatt don't shy away from any kind of cinema, adding that they do a little bit of everything. "I don't think that there are any roles that they've done that...I could've done justice to," she added. Ananya further said that she is in awe of Kareena and Alia's off-screen personalities.

309.title: 'Grammys Global Spin' recognises Armaan Malik for his single 'You'
309.article_body: Singer Armaan Malik has been recognised by the 'Grammys Global Spin', a concert series produced by the Recording Academy, for his single 'You'. The singer has become the first Indian artist to feature on the series. Initiated in 2020, the Global Spin showcases acts from around the world in order to promote global music.

310.title: We won't back down: Wikipedia as Russia threatens to block over invasion article
310.article_body: The Wikimedia Foundation said it will "not back down" after Russia threatened to block Wikipedia's Russian-language site covering Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Russia had claimed the article contained "illegally distributed information" about deaths among Ukrainian civilians and Russian forces that entered Ukraine. "We stand by our mission to deliver free knowledge to the world," Wikimedia added.

311.title: Mom saw Aashram, said 'Haye haye, you did such a role?': Bobby Deol
311.article_body: Actor Bobby Deol has revealed that his mother watched his series 'Aashram' and said, "Haye haye, tune aisa role kiya (You did such a role)?" Bobby further said that his father veteran actor Dharmendra couldn't bring himself to watch the series and told him, "Beta, main tujhe aise nahi dekh sakta (Son, I can't watch you like this)."

312.title: Don't become slave to the system: Shaan warns young singers
312.article_body: Singer Shaan has urged young singers to "not become a slave to the system" by giving in to the industry pressure. "In the long run, you are destroying yourself as an artiste. No one will take you seriously," Shaan said. The singer added there is a 'new pressure' of garnering 'higher views' online, however, the singers shouldn't lose their identity.

313.title: Rishabh Pant misses ton by 4 runs as India score 357/6 on Day 1 against Sri Lanka
313.article_body: Team India wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant missed his century by four runs as India scored 357/6 on Day 1 of the first Test against Sri Lanka in Mohali. The 24-year-old scored 96 runs off 97 deliveries, including nine fours and four sixes, and was dismissed by pacer Suranga Lakmal. Virat Kohli, who is playing his 100th Test, got out for 45(76).

314.title: Wait for official announcement: Maker of 'Mriya' reacts to video of its damage
314.article_body: Days after the world's largest aircraft 'Mriya' was destroyed by the Russian forces in Ukraine, its manufacturer, Antonov, responded to a viral video allegedly showing the damage sustained by 'Mriya'. It wrote, "Until the AN-225 has been inspected by experts, we cannot report on the technical condition of the aircraft. Please wait for the official announcements about its condition."

315.title: Priyanka, Rahul Gandhi visit Kashi Vishwanath temple in Varanasi
315.article_body: Congress leaders Priyanka and Rahul Gandhi offered prayers at the Kashi Vishwanath temple in Varanasi on Friday. The brother-sister duo's visit comes ahead of the last phase of the Uttar Pradesh assembly elections in which Varanasi will go to polls. "Whenever I or Bhaiya (Rahul) come here, we visit the temple and take Baba's blessings," said Priyanka.

316.title: 2 men posing as passengers rob cab driver using toy gun in Delhi; held
316.article_body: Two men, including a civil defence volunteer, posed as passengers and looted a cab driver using a toy gun in Delhi. Police have now arrested both the accused and recovered a car, mobile and motorcycle from their possession. According to police, the accused would often hire cabs as passengers and then stop at a deserted place to rob the driver.

317.title: India abstains in UNHRC vote on establishing inquiry commission on Ukraine crisis
317.article_body: India has abstained in UN Human Rights Council vote on establishing independent commission of inquiry on Ukraine crisis. The Council has decided to urgently establish an independent international commission of inquiry as a result of Russia's aggression against Ukraine after securing 32 votes in favour while 2 countries voted 'No'. Thirteen countries, including India, abstained from voting.

318.title: Putin is playing with fire by attacking nuclear plant: UK Defence Secy
318.article_body: UK Defence Secretary Ben Wallace said Russian President Vladimir Putin was "playing with fire" by attacking Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine. "We call upon the Russian President in the strongest possible terms to absolutely cease attacking sites such as that, it's incredibly dangerous," he added. Ukraine said the Russian military had seized the Zaporizhzhya plant after attacking it.

319.title: Leopard enters Meerut house, forest department comes to the rescue
319.article_body: A leopard was seen barging into a house located in the Pallavpuram area of Uttar Pradesh's Meerut. The Forest Department immediately rushed to the spot. The wild cat also reportedly jumped onto the road and ran adrift while they were trying to divert it away from the house. Many residents were seen gathered at the spot, ANI reported.

320.title: Maha's 1st digital clock showing its real-time population installed in Pune
320.article_body: Maharashtra's first digital population clock that shows the state's real-time population, as well as the estimated population of India, was installed at the Gokhale Institute of Politics and Economics in Pune on Friday. The state already has a population clock but it shows only the real-time population of the country. Currently, four such population clocks are operational in the country.

321.title: Jason Momoa to play villain in 'Fast & Furious 10'
321.article_body: Actor Jason Momoa has confirmed that he'll play the antagonist in the 10th instalment of the 'Fast & Furious' franchise. "It's fun, I get to play the bad guy, which I haven't gotten to do for a while. Now, I get to be...bad boy. A very flamboyant bad boy," he said. The film is expected to release in May 2023.

322.title: Disappointed, keep football out of politics: Russian coach Chernyshov
322.article_body: Talking about FIFA suspending Russia from football competitions due to the military operation in Ukraine, Mohammedan Sporting's Russian manager Andrey Chernyshov said he is "very disappointed", adding that football should be kept out of politics. "Sportsmen have nothing to do with decisions of the country's leadership," stated Chernyshov. "I hope all sanctions...will be lifted," he said.

323.title: Ukraine to unveil NFTs to support its armed forces soon: Vice PM
323.article_body: The Ukrainian government will soon unveil NFTs to support its armed forces, its Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov announced on Twitter. "Every day there are more and more people willing to help Ukraine to fight back the aggression," he added. However, he added that the government has no plans to sell fungible tokens.

324.title: Nag Ashwin seeks Mahindra's help to build futuristic vehicles for film, Mahindra replies
324.article_body: Director Nag Ashwin, who's shooting 'Project K' starring Prabhas, Amitabh Bachchan and Deepika Padukone,  sought Anand Mahindra's support in building futuristic vehicles for the movie. "How could we refuse an opportunity to help you envision the future of mobility?" Mahindra responded. "Chief of Global Product Development @Velu_Mahindra will...happily throw his weight behind you," he added.

325.title: Your lives were saved by Modiji's grace: Union Minister to Ukraine evacuees
325.article_body: A video has surfaced showing MoS for Defence Ajay Bhatt telling Indian students evacuated from Ukraine, "Your lives have been saved by (PM Narendra) Modiji's grace. Everything will be fine." The video that was widely circulated online showed Bhatt also telling the students to chant, "Bharat Mata ki jai! Mananiya Modiji Zindabad! (Victory to Bharat Mata! Long live Modiji!)"

326.title: Stop supplying products to Russia, be part of history: Ukraine Vice PM to Samsung
326.article_body: Ukraine's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov has written to Samsung Electronics CEO Jong Hee Han, appealing the company to temporarily stop supplying services and products to Russia. He also sought to limit access to Samsung Pay. "We want you to be part of history...I do believe you care about world's peace and will never support bloody authoritarian aggression," he wrote.

327.title: UN countries to create world's 1st treaty to fight plastic pollution
327.article_body: UN countries on Wednesday agreed to create world's first global treaty to fight plastic pollution across oceans, rivers and lands. "Today we wrote history. Plastic pollution has grown into an epidemic," said Espen Barth Eide, UN Environment Assembly President. Approved by 175 member countries, it is regarded as the most significant green deal since the 2015 Paris climate agreement.

328.title: NASA launches satellite for US agency to track weather activity
328.article_body: NASA on Tuesday launched the third in a series of weather satellites for US' National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) to support weather forecasts for US' West Coast, Hawaii and Alaska. The launch was a part of GOES (Geostationary Operational Environmental Satellites) program. As per NASA, the satellite will also track wildfires, flash floods, dust storms and landslides.

329.title: Delhi's Ashram underpass likely to be operational by Mar 31: Officials
329.article_body: The 750-metre-long Ashram underpass in Southeast Delhi will be operational on or before March 31, said officials. A senior PWD official said, "Work on the Ashram underpass is nearly done and...on target...[it'll] be completed by March-end." Notably, Ashram Chowk connects central and South Delhi with Noida and Faridabad areas and around 3 lakh vehicles cross the Ashram intersection every day.

330.title: Bihar medical college creates WhatsApp group for parents to 'discipline' students
330.article_body: The Patna Medical College Hospital (PMCH) in Bihar has created a WhatsApp group for parents to "discipline students and to check absenteeism", according to PMCH principal Vidyapati Choudhary. "Students bunking classes is a perennial problem. We want to inculcate a strong sense of discipline among our students," Vidyapati said. PMCH resumed physical classes for students from February 28.

331.title: Rajasthan's financial management better than that of Centre: CM Gehlot
331.article_body: Rajasthan's financial management is better than that of the Central government, CM Ashok Gehlot said. The state government has already fulfilled 85% of the previous budget announcements, he added. There were 581 announcements in the Budget 2022-23 of which 60 have already been approved, Gehlot further said. "We have fulfilled 70% of our poll manifesto promises too," he stated.

332.title: The Economist's cover features bleeding Ukrainian flag amid war with Russia
332.article_body: The cover of The Economist's upcoming edition featured the colours of the Ukrainian flag with blood emerging from it, without any headline or strapline. Sharing the cover on Instagram, The Economist wrote, "He (Putin) will not stop until he is stopped. When he escalates, the world must meet him." Earlier, TIME magazine's cover featured Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's quote.

333.title: South Korea relaxes social distancing amid record high COVID-19 cases
333.article_body: South Korea on Friday relaxed social distancing measures despite the country reporting over 2.6 lakh COVID-19 cases and 186 deaths in last 24 hours, the country's highest since the pandemic began. However, the curfew at restaurants, theatres, bars and other indoor establishments will be extended by one hour from Saturday, said Jeon Hae-cheol, Minister of the Interior and Safety.

334.title: Vihari has given Team India the same sense of calm as Pujara: Gavaskar
334.article_body: Sharing his opinion on Hanuma Vihari's 58 in the first innings of India's opening Test against Sri Lanka, Sunil Gavaskar said Vihari provided Team India the same sense of calm as Cheteshwar Pujara used to. "Vihari was impressive in South Africa where the pitches were far more difficult," added Gavaskar. Pujara has been dropped from Team India Test squad.

335.title: Tamil Nadu teacher arrested for sexual harassment after girl attempts suicide
335.article_body: A Class 11 girl student of a private school in Tamil Nadu's Cuddalore district attempted suicide following alleged sexual harassment by her school teacher. The accused was arrested after the girl filed a complaint. The girl told police that the teacher had been sending inappropriate messages to her and had asked her to spend time with him in the school.

336.title: Canada PM urges Russia to stop shelling at Ukraine's nuclear plant
336.article_body: Canada PM Justin Trudeau on Thursday urged Russia to immediately cease "unacceptable attacks" at and around Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant site. He also called on Russia to end all military activities in area and committed to continue engaging with partners and allies. Meanwhile, Ukrainian firefighters doused a blaze at Europe's biggest nuclear plant that was ignited due to Russian shelling.

337.title: NATO doesn't seek conflict with Russia, but alliance ready for it: US
337.article_body: US State Secretary Antony Blinken on Friday said that NATO will defend all its allies and territory against a Russian attack. "Ours is a defensive alliance. We seek no conflict, but if conflict comes to us we are ready for it and we will defend every inch of NATO territory," Blinken added while condemning Russia's ongoing attack on Ukraine.

338.title: Rohit Sharma's reaction to Virat Kohli getting out goes viral
338.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma's reaction to Virat Kohli's dismissal in the first innings of the first Test against Sri Lanka has gone viral. Rohit appeared shocked at the dismissal and put his hands on the head. Kohli, who was clean bowled for 45(76), appeared to be frustrated after seeing the replay of his dismissal in the dressing room.

339.title: Angad Bedi to play male lead in 'The Great Indian Kitchen' remake: Report
339.article_body: Actor Angad Bedi will reportedly be playing the male lead in the Hindi remake of Malayalam film 'The Great Indian Kitchen'. "Angad will reprise the role played by Suraj Venjaramoodu in the original," Pinkvilla reported quoting a source as saying. Being produced by Harman Baweja and Vicky Bahri, the film will star Sanya Malhotra.

340.title: Picked up from directors at work: Kriti on her role in 'Bachchhan Paandey'
340.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon opened up about playing the role of a director in 'Bachchhan Paandey'. "As an actor...just by observing and looking around, you start understanding how the directors make their vision come alive," Kriti said. The actress added, "I have seen so many talented directors at work, it feels like it was...easier for me to pick from them."

341.title: Probe against student in Ukraine for absence from UP village head duties
341.article_body: A probe has been launched against a student stuck in Ukraine for being absent from her duties as head of Tera Pursauli village in Uttar Pradesh's Hardoi. This comes after Vaishali Yadav's video seeking help from the Indian government went viral online. A panchayat official said that action will be taken against Yadav, who is studying MBBS in Ukraine.

342.title: PM Modi speaks to Bihar CM on Bhagalpur blast, condoles loss of lives
342.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi spoke to Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar regarding the blast at an illegal firecracker factory in Bhagalpur and condoled the loss of lives. In a tweet, he informed that the administration is engaged in relief and rescue work and assured all possible assistance to the injured. PM Modi also wished the injured a speedy recovery.

343.title: Dashcam captures the moment airstrike reduces residential buildings to rubble in Ukraine
343.article_body: A car's dashcam video of a Russian airstrike reducing residential buildings in Ukraine's Chernihiv into rubble has surfaced online. The video shows that the car escaped getting bombed by a few metres. At least 33 civilians had been killed in the bombardment of a residential area in Chernihiv, according to reports.

344.title: PMC eases COVID-19 curbs; malls, restaurants, gyms to operate at 100% capacity
344.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has announced further relaxations in COVID-19 restrictions in the city, effective from Friday. Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar said all shopping complexes, malls, cinema theatres, auditoriums, restaurants, bars, gyms, spas, swimming pools, religious places, tourist spots, entertainment parks etc can operate at 100% capacity and as per pre-COVID-19 timings.

345.title: Bappa remembers dad Bappi Lahiri, shares old video of him with his grandson
345.article_body: Bappa Lahiri took to Instagram to share a throwback video of his late father Bappi Lahiri. In the video, the musician is seen doing a 'jugalbandi' with his toddler grandson Krishh. "The greatest gift I ever had came from God, and I call him Daddy. Jugalbandi With #Krishh," Bappa captioned the post. Bappi passed away on February 15 in Mumbai.

346.title: Journalist held for spreading fake news about Cong in Chhattisgarh
346.article_body: A 38-year-old journalist was arrested on Thursday for allegedly spreading fake news about Congress leaders in Chhattisgarh, police said. The arrest was made based on a complaint filed by a person claiming to be a party worker. The journalist's news portal was also accused of "drawing a wedge among the leaders and office bearers of Congress", according to the FIR.
