347.title: What is the importance of Zaporizhzhya, Ukraine's nuclear plant targeted by Russia?
347.article_body: Built between 1984 and 1995, Ukraine’s Zaporizhzhya is the largest nuclear power plant in Europe and the ninth-largest in the world. It has six reactors, each of them generating 950 MW and a total power output of 5,700 MW, which is enough energy for around four million houses. It's located about 200 km from Crimea, which Russia annexed in 2014.

348.title: Some Russians using crypto as lifeline now, ban would hurt them: Coinbase CEO
348.article_body: Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong in a series of tweets said, "Some ordinary Russians are using crypto as a lifeline now that their currency has collapsed. Many of them likely oppose what their country is doing, and a ban would hurt them, too." However, he said if the US decides to impose a ban, Coinbase will follow those laws.

349.title: Old Stone Age culture from 40,000 years ago discovered in China
349.article_body: Remnants of an Old Stone Age culture from 40,000 years ago have been unearthed in China. Xiamabei, a well-preserved Palaeolithic site has been excavated by researchers in the Nihewan Basin of northern China. While they did not discover any human remains from the site, tiny, blade-like tools made from ochre, a stone rich in iron were found.

350.title: Big B was nervous before shoot of his 1st song, stayed awake all night: Anwar
350.article_body: On the 50th anniversary of 'Bombay to Goa', actor Anwar Ali recalled an anecdote from the film. He revealed that Amitabh Bachchan was "extremely nervous" the night before the shoot for his first-ever song. "Amitabh tossed and turned unable to sleep...Reassuring him...all would be fine, I fell off to sleep, but not Amitabh, who stayed awake all night," said Anwar.

351.title: Madness: Norway PM on Russia attacking Europe's largest nuclear power plant
351.article_body: Norway's PM Jonas Gahr Store said Russian shelling that led to a fire at Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine was "in line with madness". Ukrainian officials said the fire has been extinguished and no radiation leaks have been detected. If there's a leak at Zaporizhzhia plant, "it'll take about 48 hours before it arrives in Norway", Store added.

352.title: Drug peddling racket being run from Ludhiana jail busted, 2 held
352.article_body: The Special Task Force (STF) busted a drug peddling racket being run from Ludhiana Central Jail and arrested two persons on Wednesday. They recovered heroin weighing 975 gm from them. "The accused said they work for Raman Kumar...who is lodged at the...jail. Kumar would...strike deals from jail, after which he would direct them to deliver the consignment," STF said.

353.title: NSE invites applications for the role of CEO, seeks IPO experience
353.article_body: The National Stock Exchange (NSE) of India is inviting applications from candidates for the role of Managing Director and CEO. The exchange is seeking candidates having IPO (initial public offering) experience and a track record of strengthening corporate governance. The NSE's current Managing Director and CEO Vikram Limaye's five-year tenure is set to end in July 2022.

354.title: Aware of farmers' issues: Pankaj Tripathi on investing in 'Krishi Network' app
354.article_body: Actor Pankaj Tripathi, who has invested an undisclosed sum in agritech app 'Krishi Network', said having "being raised in an agriculturally rich household", he is aware of the kind of problems that farmers face. He added, lack of information is the root cause of such problems. The actor has also been named the brand ambassador of the app.

355.title: Magic of movies now 100%: Alia on 100% capacity in Maha cinemas
355.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt on Thursday took to Instagram to welcome the decision of reopening cinemas in Maharashtra with 100% occupancy for the first time since COVID-19, writing, "The magic of movies is now 100%." The actress also posted a still from her film 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'. Maharashtra on Wednesday allowed restaurants and theatres to function at 100% capacity in 14 districts.

356.title: Man sexually assaults 16-yr-old girl repeatedly, impregnates her in Pune
356.article_body: Pune Police has booked a man for sexually assaulting the 16-year-old daughter of his neighbour. According to police, the accused once gave the girl chocolate laced with sedatives and sexually assaulted her when she was unconscious and later committed the crime repeatedly. The incident reportedly came to light after the girl's parents found out that she was four months pregnant.

357.title: Rocket space junk travelling at 8,850 km/hr to hit Moon today, cause huge crater
357.article_body: A four-tonne rocket body will crash into the Moon on Friday, marking the first time that space junk is accidentally hitting lunar surface. It'll smash into a crater at a speed of 8,850 km/hr and create a crater of its own. The rocket booster, believed to be part of China's Chang'e 5-T1 mission, is expected to slam at 12.25pm GMT.

358.title: Angad is asked about his projects, I'm asked about our kids: Neha
358.article_body: Actress Neha Dhupia has revealed that she went for an event with her husband actor Angad Bedi where he was asked about his next projects. "Then they looked at me and they were like, 'Aap yahan hain toh bachho ka dhyaan kaun rakh raha hai (If you are here then who is taking care of your children)?'" the actress said.

359.title: Aman Lekhi resigns as Additional Solicitor General
359.article_body: Additional Solicitor General (ASG) of India, Aman Lekhi, tendered his resignation from the post on Friday. In his resignation letter, addressed to the Union law and justice minister Kiren Rijiju, Lekhi wrote, "Tendering my resignation...at the Supreme Court with immediate effect." The senior advocate was appointed, in March 2018, after his name was cleared by the Union Cabinet.

360.title: US Navy recovers crashed F-35 fighter jet from South China Sea
360.article_body: An F-35C Lightning II aircraft that crashed while attempting to land on an aircraft carrier in South China Sea has been recovered by US Navy. The aircraft was conducting "routine flight operations" when it crashed on January 24, it said. The recovery alleviates concerns that China or Russia might reach it first and gain access to its technology, AP reported.

361.title: Suriya once said what I'm doing is not acting, just managing it: Rana
361.article_body: Actor Rana Daggubati at a pre-release event for actor Suriya's upcoming Tamil film 'Etharkkum Thunindhavan' revealed that the latter told him 10 years ago that what he is doing is not acting, just managing it. "He took me in his car all over Hyderabad for four hours...His four-hour class made me Bhallaladeva, Daniel Shekar and many others," Rana said.

362.title: Calls for NATO no-fly zone in Ukraine irresponsible: Lithuania PM
362.article_body: Lithuanian PM Ingrida Simonyte said that any calls for NATO to enforce a no-fly zone in Ukraine would be "irresponsible" and could drag the military alliance into direct conflict with Russia. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has been calling for NATO and Western allies to enforce a no-fly zone over Ukraine amid Russia's ongoing invasion and aerial bombardment of its cities.

363.title: Reddit bans users from sharing links to Russia-backed RT & Sputnik
363.article_body: Reddit has banned users globally from posting links to Russian state-sponsored media outlets, including RT and Sputnik. It has also decided not to accept ads that target Russia or originate from any Russia-based entity, government or private. A Reddit admin reportedly confirmed that Reddit is blocking links to all websites that end in .ru.

364.title: Delhi HC creates 3 more courts to expedite trials of pending UAPA cases
364.article_body: Delhi High Court has created three new Additional Sessions Judge (ASJ) courts to expedite trials of pending Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) cases. It has decided to withdraw the pending cases from the designated National Investigation Agency (NIA) courts. This comes after five Courts of Metropolitan Magistrate (NI Act) were shifted to Rouse Avenue Court Complex in January.

365.title: Himachal govt lowers age limit for pension to 60 yrs; amount hiked to ₹1,500
365.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur, while presenting the Budget for 2022-23 in the state Assembly on Friday, announced that the monthly old-age pension amount will be increased from ₹1,001 to ₹1,500. Thakur also announced that the age limit will also be decreased from 70 years to 60 years for availing the pension, without any income limit.

366.title: Gautam Budh Nagar DM orders probe in alleged admission scam in Navodaya school
366.article_body: The Gautam Budh Nagar district magistrate has ordered an inquiry into the alleged fraud in admissions to Class 6 of the district's lone Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalaya. The central government school, located in a village in Dadri, is accused of enrolling students belonging to other districts. The inquiry will be led by the school's principal and whistleblower Anil Kumar Mishra.

367.title: Fan rightly predicts Kohli's score, way of getting out in 100th Test; tweet goes viral
367.article_body: A tweet has gone viral on social media wherein a fan rightly predicted that Virat Kohli will score 45 runs in the 100th Test. The fan, in the tweet, also correctly predicted how Kohli will get out to Sri Lanka's Lasith Embuldeniya. Reacting to the tweet, Virender Sehwag tweeted, "Wow." Another user wrote, "How can someone be so accurate?"

368.title: We're not obsessed with wealth, it's boring: World's richest man Musk's brother
368.article_body: World's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk's brother Kimbal Musk said in an interview that he and his brother aren't obsessed with wealth. "I do know other people...are obsessed with wealth...And that's not me...it's not my brother. It's boring," he added. Kimbal claimed Musk has "paid more taxes than any human on the planet in the history of America".

369.title: Sushmita Sen's ex-boyfriend Rohman Shawl to make his acting debut
369.article_body: Sushmita Sen's ex-boyfriend Rohman Shawl is set to make his acting debut. Confirming the development, he said, "Yes, I have shot for something. I'm going to share the details once I get a go-ahead from my producers. It's under post-production for now. Please keep me in your prayers." According to reports, Rohman has been taking acting workshops since 2017.

370.title: Rajesh Patil to be Administrator of Pune's PCMC from March 14
370.article_body: Maharashtra government has issued an order appointing Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Commissioner Rajesh Patil as the Administrator of PCMC from March 14, after the term of the present civic general body comes to an end on March 13. Patil will have sole authority to make policy and financial decisions. Patil's appointment was also in response to the delay of civic body elections.

371.title: Ukrainian President survives 3 assassination attempts in 1 week: Report
371.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has survived three assassination attempts since the Russian invasion began last week, a report said. It added that two different groups, the Wagner Group and Chechen rebels, were sent to kill Zelenskyy. Earlier, Ukrainian official Oleksiy Danilov said Russia's Federal Security Service alerted them about Chechen special forces sent to kill Zelenskyy.

372.title: BharatPe removes Ashneer Grover's profile from its website days after his exit
372.article_body: Days after his resignation as the MD and director, BharatPe has removed Ashneer Grover’s profile and photo from its website. In a statement, the company had accused Grover and his wife Madhuri Jain of misappropriating company funds to fund their lavish lifestyle. The 'About Us' page now features Co-Founder Shashvat Nakrani, CEO Suhail Sameer, Nishit Sharma, among others.

373.title: You will see me on OTT very soon: 'Mohabbatein' star Preeti Jhangiani
373.article_body: Actress Preeti Jhangiani, known for films like 'Mohabbatein' and 'Awara Paagal Deewana', said the audience will soon get to see her on an OTT platform. The actress pointed out the lack of interesting projects as her reason for absence from the industry. "I got selective and nothing great in terms of characters was coming my way," Preeti added.

374.title: Last thing you want is to create uncertainty: Hesson on coaching Kohli
374.article_body: RCB's Director of Cricket and former head coach Mike Hesson said the last thing you want to do while coaching batters like Virat Kohli, AB de Villiers is "create uncertainty" around techniques or anything else. "If you see something that's...not...right, you just observe for a while and then...ask questions because these players are great for a reason," added Hesson.

375.title: 30 people killed, 56 injured in a bomb blast at Pakistan mosque during Friday prayer
375.article_body: At least 30 people were killed and 56 others injured in a bomb blast inside a mosque in Pakistan's Peshawar on Friday, police said. "We are in a state of emergency and the injured are being shifted to the hospital. We are investigating the nature of the blast but it seemed to be a suicide attack," a police officer said.

376.title: B'luru court orders Apple to refund ₹92,000 to man for not fixing iPhone
376.article_body: Bengaluru consumer court has ordered Apple India and its service centre to give a man a new iPhone or refund equivalent money, i.e, ₹92,000, for allegedly refusing to repair his iPhone, which was under warranty. It observed the parties failed to repair the device of a genuine customer. It also ordered them to pay ₹20,000 as compensation to the man.

377.title: Kim Kardashian drops surname 'West' after being declared legally single
377.article_body: American media personality Kim Kardashian has dropped the surname 'West' after she was declared legally single amid her divorce with rapper Ye, formerly known as Kanye West. Kim, who married Ye nearly eight years ago, had recently filed documents to be declared single. She had filed for divorce last year in February.

378.title: Vladimir Putin is at risk of ending up in prison for war crimes: UK on Ukraine war
378.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin is at risk of ending up in prison for war crimes carried out by his forces in Ukraine, Deputy Prime Minister of the UK Dominic Raab has said. An investigation by the International Criminal Court (ICC) is currently underway, with officials reportedly already in Ukraine probing whether war crimes have been carried out there.

379.title: FIR filed against UP MLA Mukhtar Ansari's son for 'hisab kitab' remark
379.article_body: An FIR has been registered against UP MLA Mukhtar Ansari's son Abbas Ansari for his 'hisab kitab' remark. "I've told Akhilesh Yadav that no transfers...of government officials will happen for six months as 'hisab kitab' will happen with them first if Suheldev Bhartiya Samaj Party-Samajwadi Party alliance wins," Abbas had said. Abbas is contesting UP Assembly elections from Mau Sadar.

380.title: Never been prouder to be Ukrainian: Mila on Russia-Ukraine conflict
380.article_body: Actress Mila Kunis and her husband actor Ashton Kutcher have released a video on Instagram in which the actress said, "I have never been more proud to be a Ukrainian." "And I've never been more proud to be married to a Ukrainian," Ashton added. Mila also urged fans to help raise funds for refugees fleeing Ukraine amid the Russian invasion.

381.title: Randeep Hooda's knee surgery successful: Report
381.article_body: Actor Randeep Hooda's knee surgery after sustaining an injury on the sets of his upcoming series 'Inspector Avinash' has been completed successfully, reported Free Press Journal. The actor had been shooting for an action sequence with his co-star Amit Sial. Randeep had reportedly hurt the same knee earlier while shooting 2021 film 'Radhe' which starred Salman Khan.

382.title: UP constable carries elderly woman to poll booth in his arms, video goes viral
382.article_body: Video showing a policeman carrying an elderly woman to a polling booth in his arms has gone viral online. Identified as Pawan Kumar, the policeman is posted as a constable in Uttar Pradesh's Gorakhpur. Calling Kumar a true watchdog of democracy, UP Police tweeted they are proud of him for helping the woman cast her vote at Assembly Elections.

383.title: Don't expect Paine to play cricket in 2022: Tasmania interim coach
383.article_body: Discussing former Australia Test captain Tim Paine who is on an indefinite break from cricket following a 'sexting' scandal, interim Tasmania Tigers head coach Ali De Winter said he doesn't expect Paine to play in 2022. "Paine's obviously shattered with what's happened. His life has changed," former Australia head coach Justin Langer had earlier said.

384.title: Underwater noise pollution may cause hearing loss in turtles: Scientists
384.article_body: Underwater noise pollution caused due to shipping and offshore construction may lead to hearing loss in turtles, scientists have warned. This hearing loss can last from a few minutes to days. "Over half of turtle and tortoise species are threatened, and noise pollution is an additional stressor to consider as we work towards protecting these animals," researcher Andria Salas said.

385.title: Russian news channel staff resigns on air, walks off after saying 'no war'
385.article_body: Independent Russian television channel TV Rain suspended its operations after being asked to shut operations by authorities over its coverage of Ukraine's invasion. A video showed the staff resigning on air and walking off, after saying, "No war." The channel then played 'Swan Lake' ballet video which was also played on all Soviet channels in 1991 during the civil unrest.

386.title: Renault shares fall to lowest since Nov 2020 amid Russia-Ukraine war
386.article_body: The price of shares of French automaker Renault has fallen since last week to trade at their lowest since November 2020, amid the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war. It has reportedly lost around a quarter of its market value after the Russian invasion and growing sanctions. Renault, which owns a majority stake in Russian automaker Avtovaz, is monitoring the situation in Ukraine.

387.title: BSF rescues 23 cattle in Assam from being smuggled to Bangladesh
387.article_body: The Border Security Force (BSF) rescued 23 cattle from NH-6 at Hilara area in Assam's Cachar district on Thursday. The cattle were meant to be smuggled to Bangladesh, BSF said in a statement. Recently, Director-General of BSF, Pankaj Kumar Singh, had also informed that the forces are using technologically advanced devices to stop livestock smuggling along the India-Bangladesh border.

388.title: Omicron found in 100% of COVID-19 samples in Mumbai in latest genome sequencing
388.article_body: As per the latest round of genome sequencing carried out by the BMC, Omicron variant was found in 100% of the COVID-19 samples tested from Mumbai. Of the 237 patients, 103 or 44% were unvaccinated, BMC's report states. "There is nothing to panic about. But we should continue to adhere to COVID-19-appropriate behaviour," BMC Additional Commissioner Suresh Kakani said.

389.title: NATO must change posture after Russia's invasion of Ukraine: Romania
389.article_body: Romanian Foreign Minister Bogdan Aurescu on Friday said that NATO must adapt military posture at its eastern flank to a new reality following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Romania will increase its defence spending to 2.5% from 2% of GDP starting with the next fiscal year, he added. Aurescu also mentioned the presence of Russian troops in Belarus.

390.title: Russia-backed media outlet RT America shuts down, fires most of its staff
390.article_body: Russia-backed media outlet RT America is shutting down operations and laying off most of its employees, CNN reported. T&R Productions, the production company behind RT America, attributed the decision to "cease production" to "unforeseen business interruption events" in a memo to its staff. Earlier, satellite operator DirecTV stopped carrying RT America in response to Russian invasion of Ukraine.

391.title: Denial of physical relationship in marriage is cruelty: HC while granting divorce
391.article_body: Chhattisgarh High Court has held that denial of physical relationship by one spouse to the other in a matrimonial relationship amounts to cruelty. The court allowed the plea for divorce made by the husband in this case. "Physical relationship between husband and wife is one of the important parts for healthy married life," the court stated.

392.title: Over 1.67 lakh Ukrainians entered Romania since Russian invasion
392.article_body: More than 1.67 lakh Ukrainians have crossed the Ukraine-Romania border since Russia invaded the country on February 24, border police data showed on Friday. About 1,09,687 of those have already driven or flown out of Romania. The people entered Romania through its four land border checkpoints with Ukraine and also through its checkpoints with Moldova, the data showed.

393.title: Russia planning public executions in Ukraine after cities are captured: Report
393.article_body: Russia's intelligence agency, Federal Security Service, is planning public executions in conquered Ukrainian cities in order to shatter morale, according to a European intelligence official. "[It] is also planning violent crowd control and repressive detention of protest organisers," reports said while citing Bloomberg. Russia has seized Europe's largest nuclear power plant situated in Ukraine.

394.title: Virat Kohli recalls old photo with Rahul Dravid during speech, pic goes viral
394.article_body: The old photograph with Rahul Dravid that Virat Kohli mentioned in his speech while being felicitated for his 100th Test match has gone viral. "I still have the picture in my house from my Under-15 NCA days, when I was looking at you. Today...I get my 100th Test cap from you...so indeed it has been a great journey," Kohli said.

395.title: Who is Sanjiv Kapoor, the new CEO of Jet Airways?
395.article_body: Sanjiv Kapoor, who reportedly resigned as President of Oberoi Hotels this week, will join Jet Airways as its new CEO on April 4. Kapoor, a Wharton School MBA graduate, started his airline career with Northwest Airlines in the US in 1997. He was SpiceJet's COO between 2013 and 2015 and Vistara's Chief Strategy and Commercial Officer between 2016 and 2019.

396.title: The only way to end Ukraine war is to assassinate Putin: US politician
396.article_body: US politician Lindsey Graham has called for the assassination of Russian President Vladimir Putin amid Russia-Ukraine war and said, "The only way this ends is for somebody in Russia to take this guy out." "Is there a Brutus in Russia? Is there a more successful Colonel Stauffenberg in the Russian military," he tweeted.

397.title: Pak court says Jadhav has right to fair trial, asks India to appoint lawyer
397.article_body: Pakistan's Islamabad High Court on Thursday observed that former Indian Navy officer Kulbhushan Jadhav is a human being and cannot be denied the right to a fair trial, reported Pakistan daily Dawn. The court has also asked India to appoint a lawyer for him by April 13. Jadhav was sentenced to death by a Pakistani military court in 2017.

398.title: Updating software to power Starlink via car cigarette lighters: Musk to Ukraine Vice PM
398.article_body: Responding to Ukrainian Vice PM Mykhailo Fedorov, Elon Musk said SpaceX's Starlink is getting an update to reduce peak power consumption, so it can be powered from car cigarette lighters. Mobile roaming also activated to maintain a signal even while in a moving vehicle, Musk added. Fedorov had sought ideas from Musk to keep Starlink services online amid Russian invasion.

399.title: Aamir Khan told me that I must do 'Jhund': Amitabh Bachchan
399.article_body: Veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan has revealed that when he discussed 'Jhund' with actor Aamir Khan, the latter said that he must do the film. "And you know what happens when Aamir endorses something," the veteran actor added. Aamir had earlier called 'Jhund' one of Amitabh Bachchan's greatest films, saying that it breaks everything he has learnt in 20-30 years.

400.title: West Indies take 3 wickets in last over, defeat New Zealand in Women's World Cup opener
400.article_body: West Indies defeated hosts New Zealand by three runs in 2022 Women's World Cup opener in Mount Maunganui. West Indies put up a total of 259/9 before dismissing New Zealand for 256 runs in 49.5 overs. West Indies took three wickets in last over. This is the first time that West Indies won a women's international match in New Zealand.

401.title: Happiest day of my life: Seema shares pics from son Mayank's wedding to Sanah
401.article_body: Actress Seema Bhargava Pahwa took to Instagram to share pictures from her son Mayank Pahwa's wedding with actress Sanah Kapur, daughter of Pankaj Kapur and Supriya Pathak. "Happiest day in my life. God bless you both...feel proud to announce my son MAYANK PAHWA & SANAH KAPUR got married so so happy," she wrote. Mayank and Sanah got married on Wednesday.

402.title: US waives COVID-19 tests for Americans leaving Russia, Belarus
402.article_body: The US State Department said the country is waiving a requirement for negative COVID-19 tests from Americans leaving Belarus or Russia to travel home. "This exercise of enforcement discretion is limited to US citizens, permanent residents, and holders of valid immigrant visas who were in either country as of February 28," the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said.

403.title: Coinbase, Binance not to ban all Russians from platforms
403.article_body: Cryptocurrency exchanges Coinbase and Binance have said that they have no plans to preemptively ban all Russians from using their platforms. "We believe everyone deserves access to basic financial services unless the law says otherwise," Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong said. "We are not going to unilaterally freeze millions of innocent users' accounts," Binance said.
